Ce qui fait le charme special de cet endroit est bien sur, la presence de Arthur et Ed. A la fois discrets et conviviaux, chaleureux et genereux, ils sont des hotes attentionnes qui ont fait de notre sejour un moment memorable. A bientot!

Everything as described. The whole apartment has a nice and cozy atmosphere. Ed and Arthur are doing everything to make you stay an unforgettable experience. If you love Chelsea, this is the place to be!

Great base in Chelsea, New York. Easy access to tourist sites close to subway and buses. Very comfortable apartment with good facilities including breakfast, log fires, private bathroom. Whole experience significantly enhanced by the generosity, knowledge and kindness of Arthur and Ed. Great recommendations to places, restaurants, etc. Would love to stay again!

My girlfriend and I had a fantastic stay at Arthur and Ed´s apartment! They where super friendly, very charming and really easy going. Being their guests felt very natural. They gave us many great tips and restaurant recommendations. They made our first airbnb experience perfect!  




About the apparent: 
The room was very clean and cosy, with a nice view to the high line. The bathroom was modern, clean and very nice. 

The location is really perfect. Lots of good restaurants, the Chelsea Market and a lots of nice galleries. 

We really hope to stay here again!
Very cozy and great location in Chelsea.

Art and Ed couldn't be better hosts. We arrived tired and hungry after a long journey from Australia to be greeted with a roaring fire, two very welcoming hosts and the offer of dinner! We had a great evening and this set us up perfectly for the rest of our stay.

The apartment itself was beautiful: great location (quiet and central), very comfortable, and Art and Ed are amazingly thoughtful with all the little extras they do for you. We would both love to stay there again.

Me and my sister had the most fantastic of times staying at Arthur & Ed's place when visiting NYC. We were greeted so warmly, the room and rest of apartment were everything claimed to be and more, and we were so comfortable throughout our stay. Arthur and Ed definitely both helped to make our experience in New York memorable; sharing history and stories and recommending good spots for food, coffees and art. This in addition to making sure we had everything we needed around the house and making us feel very at home. We were sad to leave and look forward to going back to New York and would choose this stay again without any doubt!

Je crois sincèrement qu'il était impossible de trouver mieux que chez Arthur et Ed. l'appartement est très agréable, à l'image des propriétaires, qui sont d'une gentillesse incroyable. De plus leurs conseils sont très avisés, et utiles (visites, resto etc...)
On se sent immédiatement très à l'aise chez eux, à tel point qu'on en oublie presque de sortir visiter cette ville sublime.

Quand je vais revenir à NY, je ne vais pas hésiter une seule seconde, et c'est chez eux que je reviendrai.

Have stayed in the apartment of Arhtur and Ed was just amazing! we had the service of a luxury hotel with the personal touch and warmth that both have! 
they gave us valuable tips and had an immense care before and during our stay. 
I have only praise for these two! thanks a lot!

You will be treated well and be very happy if you get to stay on the Highline with Art and Ed. Their listing is deservedly popular because of the location which provides great access to the entire city from the N-S Blue Line subway stop and the cross-town #23 bus just around the corner.  The Chelsea neighborhood itself is great, especially if you like galleries and want to explore the fabulous Highline (the best thing to happen to NYC since Central Park).  But the real treat here are your hosts, Ed and Arthur, who do everything and more to make your stay the best it can be.  From the beginning we were treated like friends rather than lodgers.  They were generous with information, fun stories, kitchen use, recommendations and their time.  For us, always, our travel experiences are shaped by the people we meet along the way.  Getting to know Art and Ed was one of the highlights of five fabulous days in NYC.

Our recent stay with Ed & Arthur far exceeded our highest expectations.  Every attempt was made to make our visit exceptional.  Prior to my wife and I coming they sought out what we might need or want to make us most comfortable.  Our room overlooked the scenic HighLine walkway and we had access to their spacious living room area & kitchen.  Ed was a most gracious and entertaining host (Art was away) who was always available to help.  We never felt more at ease and comfortable.  During our stay we also had a lot of privacy.  Almost felt liked we lived there. Everything about Ed & Arthur's airbnb was well organized, very clean, efficient, and personable. We now won't stay anywhere else in NYC!

Art and Ed are lovely, they really know how to make guests feel welcome. The apartment is so close to the Highline (a real highlight and retreat from the pace of the City), which makes the location wonderful. The room is very comfortable, the bathroom total luxury, and the rest if the apartment is gorgeous too. The hosts' living space is upstairs which gives them, as well as guests, plenty of privacy. 

Everything was wonderful regarding communication and checking in/out, all easy and stress-free. The breakfast was a welcome touch too! Perfect for a slower paced start to the busy NYC days.

My stay couldn't have been better and I was really glad to be able to sit down with Art on my last morning and have a great chat. I'd definitely visit again. No hesitation!

My daughter and I had lovely time staying with Art and Ed. The room was perfect for us and the air conditioning kept us cool as the temperature increased. Our private bathroom was very welcome and the breakfast provided was excellent.
We used the subway frequently and the apartment was only a few minutes walk away and  the High-Line took us to one of our favourite areas of town.
The boys were very gracious and even went out and bought us mint tea !
A great experience.

Location eccellente: bus sotto casa e metro a due isolati, nello stesso blocco si trovano le più belle gallerie d'arte di Chelsea ed a 20 metri dalle finestre della camera vi è  la splendida High Line. L'appartamento è bellissimo e  la camera ed il bagno (privato) assolutamente confortevoli.  Ed ed Art sono simpatici ed affabili. Io e mia moglie  abbiamo soggiornato per due settimane e, nella seconda, assenti Ed ed Art, è subentrata Kim,  una bella e gentile  signora,  alla quale far riferimento.  Già nel primo giorno a casa, in Italia, mia moglie rimpiange le luci soffuse e la musica soft presenti nel  soggiorno tutta la notte. È stata  la nostra prima esperienza Airbnb e non sappiamo immaginare una sistemazione migliore.  Un grazie sincero ad Ed, Art e Kim.     Luciana e Renzo

A great location in a relaxed yet vibrant part of New York. Very close to the blue metro line A,C,E, ideal to connect directly with JFK Airport, World Trade Center, 42nd Street, various Broadway sections and Times Square, Central Park and the Museum of Natural History, The MoMa, 5th Avenue and Rockefeller Center... The high line, outstanding example of urban architecture and art, is right around the corner, allowing wonderful strolls down to Chelsea Market. Pharmacy, shops and restaurants, and the fascinating waterside are all nearby.  Ed & Art have prepared a nice colored map allowing you to find the right way to reach the most important places.  Their home is nice and cozy, the hosts are accommodating and relaxed, their cats sweet and quiet. The stairs are steep and narrow, take you time with bulky overseas  luggage. Air conditioning and fans in every room work perfectly and 24/7 round... but probably Europeans will have hard times to get used to the freezer effect and constant buzz (which is the norm all over the city, though, including trains, busses, boats). The room is not sterile or completely empty as in a hotel room, so their stuff and your stuff just look like being part of one family. (Just make sure you don't leave some socks or take away one of their coats). The mattresses were perfect for us, not too hard not too soft, with a thicker and a thinner pillow for those who the perfect height. Bathroom is all black without windows (could be claustrophobic for somebody) but well organized, especially a with spacious shower. What you need is available as in any real home, including books and brochures about the city, spare USA plug adapters, disposable razor blades or some aspirin. Should we come back to NYC sure we come back to Ed&Art, and will definitively recommend it to all our friends.

If you want to be centrally located in manhattan - If you want to stay with people who are truly interested in you having a fulfilling and low stress vacation - you really should consider Art and Ed's place in the heart of Chelsea.  It is right on the Chelsea HighLine, which is a terrific addition to a city that doesn't even need more reasons to visit!  Art and Ed could not have been more helpful to us.  It is like having a concierge in-house. If we had a question, we had a human version of (Hidden by Airbnb) to check in with!  Also - if cleanliness is important to you - this location will make you so happy!  It also feels great to not worry about your personal belongings as you do in hotels.  If you have not tried this sort of housing in NYC, Art and Ed's place is a perfect start.

Wir haben sehr gute Erfahrungen mit dem Gastgeber und der Unterkunft gemacht. Es gibt nichts, was es zu bemängeln gäbe. Wir wurden freundlich empfangen und mit vielen Tipps für unseren Besuch ausgestattet. Das Zimmer und das Bad waren sehr sauber; alles, was man benötigt, war vorhanden - Hotelstandard! Super!
Die Lage der Unterkunft ist top - von JFK aus kommt man problemlos mit einmal umsteigen hin, auch viele Sehenswürdigkeiten sind bequem mit der Subway zu erreichen, die nur wenige Minuten Fußmarsch entfernt ist. Zwei Buslinien fahren direkt vor dem Haus und die Highline liegt direkt hinter dem Haus. Am Hudson River oder dem schönen Chelsea Market ist man ebenfalls in wenigen Minuten!
Insgesamt sehr empfehlenswert!!!

Me and my boyfriend stayed for 4 nights. It was really awesome! The flat is fantastic and really quit for a central NYC Manhatten place. The bedroom is on the backside with the High Line directly behind it. Really nice! The room and beds are cosy, your own bathroom next to it very convenient. It was really great to have some food you could eat for breakfast (joghurt, banana, toast, jam, butter, sweets, orangejuice and coffee). So we were ready for the day every day without searching for breakfast. Unfortunately Art & Ed went on vacation, so we only had the chance to talk to them one night. Arthur gave us some exciting information about the city and advice what things to do and how to get there. If we had more time we probably would have learned more about them and their interesting family history and some more insider facts about NYC. Nevertheless there where a lot of infos on the wall & fridge in the kitchen as well. We were lucky to meet Ed's nice niece Kim. She was there when we arrived and helped us a lot! Pollux & Castor are really shy at the beginning and later they got used to us as guests, but you should really close the door. Pets are curious, but who is not. All in all we could not have a better place to stay in Manhatten!

Absolutely LOVED our time with Art and Ed in their gorgeous home. Gracious, fun hosts who showed us a side of New York that we would have otherwise not experienced. Generous breakfast spread, extremely comfortable beds and lovely bathroom. Location, location, location!One of the best places we have stayed through Air BNB worldwide. Thank You Art and Ed.

Where to begin? The apartment is in a great location, convenient for many attractions, not far from the subway and so convenient for the Highline. There are plenty of restaurants and bars starting right next to the apartment. 

The apartment itself is lovely, very comfortable, with cereal, fruit and bread & spreads, tea and coffee provided for breakfast.

The hosts, Ed and Art are the most congenial of hosts - frankly, it's like staying with a couple of good friends.

1. El lugar tiene una ubicación privilegiada, es fácil desplazarse a cualquier lugar, en metro o bus. Tiene cerca buenos lugares para comer. Es un distrito atractivo para caminar.

2. La recámara y el baño son cómodos y amplios, con todos lo necesario para tener una estancia como en casa.

3. El desayuno es rico y abundante, en una preciosa y espaciosa cocina, con posibilidad de usarla para comer o cenar con tranquilidad.

4. Lo más importante son los anfritriones, Arthur y Ed, personas fantásticas, hacen sentir a sus invitados como en casa, siempre dispuestos a dar consejos para conocer NYC profundamente y auxiliar en todo lo que sea necesario para hacer del viaje una gran experiencia, conocerlos fue lo mejor en estas vacaciones.

5. Todo complementado con la posibilidad de convivir, a ratos, con dos lindos gatitos.

6. En conclusión, lugar altamente recomendable.


1. The place has a privileged location, it is easy to move to any place, in subway or bus. It takes place nearby to eat. It is an attractive district to walk.

2. The bedroom and the bath are comfortable and wide, with all the necessary to have a stay as in house.

3. The breakfast is delicious and abundant, in a precious and spacious kitchen, with possibility of using her to eat or to have dinner.

4. The most important, Arthur and Ed, fantastic persons, make feel his guests as in house, always ready to give advices to know NYC deeply and to help in everything what is necessary to do of the trip a great experience, they are the best of our holiday.

5. The kitties are charming.

6. In conclusion, highly advisable place.

We are just back from a great time in NYC.  Art and Ed are remarkable...from the minute we arrived we felt welcomed and supported by  their good ideas, truly lovely home (spacious, comfortable, quiet and well located) and helpful guidance.  They are amazing.  The high line is a NYC MUST and they know the restaurants (check out "Bar Centrale" when you go to a show...wouldn't have found it without Art's help).  We'll stay there again in a heart beat.  Also, the home is very clean and the neighborhood is safe.

Nous revenons d'un séjour de quatre nuits chez Arthur et Ed que nous remercions chaleureusement de leur accueil. L'appartement est aussi beau et spacieux que sur les photos. Nous avions à disposition la cuisine très bien équipée pour éventuellement préparer un repas. Tous les matins tous les ingrédients d'un parfait breakfast étaient prêts ( jus d'orange, fruits frais, yaourts ..)
La salle à manger salon et le salon sont très agréables pour se reposer des longues marches new-yorkaises et musique douce et petits chocolats sonr là pour vous réconforter.
La chambre est conforme à la photo avec 2 lits simples que l'on peut rapprocher. Une commode et des espaces de rangement sont à la disposition des invités. Les lits étaient faits.
La salle d 'eau est totalement privative ainsi que les WC et tout est vraiment prévu pour que vous vous sentiez chez vous: serviettes de toilette, coton, kleenex, bougies parfumées et produits cosmétiques.
Cet appartement est situé dans le quartier de Chelsea, très agréable, riche en petits restaurants sympathiques et relativement peu chers.
La high line vous permettra d'aller faire votre footing ou votre promenade romantique le soir à l'heure du sunset puisqu'elle est à accessible par l'escalier qui jouxte l'immeuble
Dès lors de la réservation, nous avons eu des contacts par mail avec Arthur et Ed qui très spontanément nous ont proposés de répondre à toutes les questions que nous pouvions nous poser pour notre séjour à NYC mais aussi sur l'ensemble de notre voyage américain.
Trés gentiment ils nous ont indiqués les sites qu'ils appréciaient sur notre parcours ce qui nous a permis d'enrichir notre programme.
Etant absents le jour de notre arrivée, ils nous ont prévenus que Kim nous attendrait à l'heure prévue.
Celle-ci a tout fait pour nous rendre l' installation facile, elle nous a donné tous les renseignements pratiques et nous savions que nous pouvions l'appeler en cas de besoin.
Le meilleur reste à venir: parlons maintenant des propriétaires.
Un point très rassurant pour tous les français qui ne maitrisent pas la langue de Shakespeare, Arthur possède un français plus que parfait!
Extrêmement prévenant, d'une grande culture artistique, il vous guidera vers les nombreux musées et les sites historiques de NYC.
Par ailleurs Arthur vous indiquera tous les bons plans : restaurants, bars, galeries, lieux de musique ..
En fin de séjour, Ed et Arthur nous ont laissé la disponibilité de la chambre jusqu'à notre départ en fin d'après midi pour prendre notre avion décollant à 21 h 50, ce que nous avons vivement apprécié.
Pour vous décrire l'amabilité d'Arthur, il nous a réservé un taxi pour notre départ et est allé jusqu'à descendre les bagages.
En résumé, nous ne pouvons que vous recommander cette adresse en n'oubliant pas de vous préciser que tout est très propre et que vous pouvez facilement vous garer devant l'immeuble pour déposer vos bagages.

Upon walking in the door, we both felt immediately welcome into Ed & Arthur's home. We were given a fantastic introduction to New York with a brief history and key locations to visit. The accommodation is clean, modern, comfortable and cozy. Providing the right amount of privacy and interaction with hosts. We appreciated our own room and private bathroom. Breakfast provided was fresh and delicious. Location of accommodation is fantastic.  Great view of the high line from the kitchen and bedroom. Outstanding hospitality provided by the hosts. We look forward to returning to stay with Arthur & Ed in the future.

We stayed with Arthur and Ed during a busy weekend trip and I can't say enough good things about their place or their expertise as hosts. As with the rest of the Highline neighborhood, their listing can only get more and more in demand, unfortunately for us, and with good reason. Their Chelsea neighborhood, and access to everything you need for a great NY trip, is fantastic. We had no trouble with the thorough instructions they provided and they made themselves available before our arrival in case we needed any help making this a successful trip. Their BnB was exactly as advertised and as charming as it could be. A comfortable room and well appointed bath were all we were expecting but we got so much more. We actually ran out of time to take advantage of all of Ed's suggestions regarding fun NY activities. We plan on returning to continue with his list. If you want to experience the life available in NYC, without going through the buffer of a hotel, you can get it here. We look forward to returning.

Ed and Art were terrific. They made me feel very welcome. Gracious and generous hosts. They were helpful and friendly. I am grateful for their willingness to open their home to a total stranger. I was comfortable and enjoyed my stay. I will definitely be back!

A very relaxed and welcoming place to stay. Arthur and Ed helped us feel at ease. Our room and facilities were very well appointed. Their apartment provides an artistically designed environment. A fantastic area to feel part of in New York and having immediate access to the High Line meant we always had access to an open green environment with views across the city and river.

We had a great time at Arthur and Ed's home. They were the best hosts you can think of, giving us a warm welcome and a real feeling of being at home. Ed gave a lot of tips what to see, where to eat and how to get everywhere. We tried most of the restaurants and attractions he told us of and had a lot of fun. 
The room was cosy and everything was very clean. At the highline park, it's a perfect location. 
Thanks for the stay!

Min søster og jeg havde et fantastisk ophold hos Art & Ed - de er to fantastiske personer som er gode til at få en til at føle sig velkommen og hjemme. 

Det var vores først tur til NYC og Art gav os rigtig gode tips og trick til byen og dens seværdigheder, samt har de en stor historiske viden om New York City som er skøn at høre på.

Nous avons passé un magnifique séjour à New-York avec des hôtes très accueillants.  L'adresse est a recommander absolument.  Belle situation, très beau duplex, calme, sympatique, très propre et vue sur l'Highline.
Nous nous y sentions très bien et le contact avec nos hôtes a été dès le début très agréable.  Le déjeûner était copieux.
Rien a redire.

Our stay at Arthur & Eds was perfect for our 5 days in New York.  They are very warm and welcoming hosts.  The accommodation was excellent, exactly as presented on the webpage.  A very well appointed spacious bedroom, and spotlessly presented bathroom.
We were given a very warm welcome, lots of information on what to see and do in New York.  The location is excellent with bus and subway close by.  A supermarket and lots of cafes and restaurants close by.  
We were able to leave our luggage on the last day and as our flight was late at night were able to have a shower and freshen up before leaving for the airport.  All in all - a great stay.  Thank you!

It was our first Air B&B experience and it could not have been better. Everything was precisely as described. Arthur & Ed were fantastic hosts. When we arrived, Arthur explained us everything and gave us helpful insider tips for our visit in NYC.  The neighborhood is trendy with some good and reasonably priced restaurants and many arts galleries. Bus stops are right in front of the house, but midtown is only a half hour walk away. All in all we enjoyed our stay with Arthur and Ed a lot and can highly recommend to stay with them.

初めてのairB&B体験は､Ed&Arthurのおかげで素晴らしいものになりました｡彼ら自身によるｱﾊﾟｰﾄ案内やﾚﾋﾞｭｰを読んでいたので､期待はしていましたが､実際､それ以上に素晴らしかったです｡会った瞬間にほっとできるような親しみやすく､優しい笑顔の2人は､NYの情報をたくさんくれ､私の英語がつたないにも関わらず､歴史的､文化的な話もたくさんしてくれました(とても面白かった!)｡部屋とﾊﾞｽﾙｰﾑは書いてあったとおりｽｰﾊﾟｰｸﾘｰﾝで､ﾍﾞｯﾄﾞの寝心地も最高｡ﾁｪﾙｼｰはｱｯﾌﾟﾀｳﾝにもﾀﾞｳﾝﾀﾝにもいきやすく､おもしろいｷﾞｬﾗﾘｰとおいしいﾚｽﾄﾗﾝがたくさんあって､素晴らしい地区です｡次もぜひ､またここに泊まりたい!

If anyone had told me that one of the highlights of their trip to New York was their airbnb accommodation I would not have believed them; but that was definitely the case for us. We traveled from Australia to spend 11 nights in Ed and Art’s beautiful home and it was perfect. Everything you read in the reviews is true. Ed and Art are kind, warm and generous people and immediately make you feel at home. 
The neighborhood is wonderful. There are plenty of ‘cheap eats’ in the area and the high line is magnificent. Many times we came home exhausted after a big day out and collapsed in to bed, other times we stayed up chatting with our wonderful hosts. Whatever suits you is also fine with them. Art is totally charming and so very helpful. Ed loves to tell a story and is very funny.
The home is glorious; the bedroom is clean, spacious and beautifully furnished and the breakfast options generous…what more can I say. They made our stay the success that it was. Thanks Ed and Art xx

Mi experiencia en la casa de Arthury Ed fue excente !
Los dos, muy educados y atentos  constantemente ,ademas de ser muy cultos y responder cualquiera de nuestras preguntas.

La casa nos encanto, el lugar perfecto con vista a High line.
Me encanto todo !
Volveria al mismo lugar !
  Gracias por todo Arthur y Ed

Adriana

Un grand merci à Ed et Arthur pour leur chaleureux accueil, Patricia et moi-même avons passé une inoubliable semaine à New York. Nous avons très bien mangé grâce à leurs bonnes adresses. À nos petits soins, soucieux de notre bien être. 
Très bel appartement dans Chelsea.
Un vrai bonheur nos footing sur la High Line!!

Arthur greeted us when we arrived, gave us a little orientation, and made us feel most welcome. Ed and Arthur are genial and respectful hosts. The room was clean and tidy, and near the kitchen. Windows form the bedroom looked out on the High Line--lovely. The bathroom was clean and well appointed. We felt comfortable making coffee and eating a light breakfast in the spotless kitchen.  Our hosts provided lots of guidebooks and some good tips for sights in the area. We've been to New York many times and have lived here for short stints, but never explored Chelsea, so this was a  first. Lincoln Center, our evening destination, was a short bus ride away, and we were easily able to walk from  Penn Station and our Amtrak train to Arthur and Ed's home.

We had a wonderful welcome from Art, who was so thoughtful after our long journey. Krys was given a beautiful box of birthday cup cakes and card. The house looked amazing, with the tree and hearth all decorated for Christmas.The accommodation is so comfortable with everything we needed and in such a great location. Art's tips for places to see and where to eat were spot on which helped us to make the most of our short visit. It was good to get to meet Ed on our last evening.
We were able to do lots of walking but also found that the M11 bus up 10th Avenue was a really fast service. Art and Ed are such a kind couple and we couldn't have picked better hosts for Krys' first trip to New York. Thank you

The perfect spot if you love art! We stayed with Art & Ed just before Thanksgiving and had a wonderful time visiting museums, the High Line and all the galleries clustered around their Chelsea neighborhood. And don't forget their own personal art collection (and huge Christmas tree)! Art and Ed were excellent hosts.  They provided great trip guidance beforehand and during the stay. They have several guides to city attractions (and personal experiences) you can use to plan each day.Their home is immaculate and the guest bath is fabulous. They offered a quick Continental breakfast for each day but we couldn't pass up the excellent Sullivan St. Bakery only a few blocks away (tasting the breakfast panini right now!). You can literally watch people walking  on the High Line only 50' away from their breakfast room window. A few steps and you're walking there yourself. Subway stops are close by to take you anywhere in the city. One of our favorite AirBnB vacations!

wij hadden een zeer aangenaam verblijf bij Arthur en Ed. We werden zeer hartelijk ontvangen, met een kopje koffie en kregen veel uitleg en tips over de omgeving en wat er allemaal te beleven viel. De kamer en de badkamer waren zeer proper. We mochten ook gebruik maken van hun gezellige huiskamer, met open haard. Hun B&B is zeer goed gelegen, vlak bij de Highline en er is een metrostation niet ver vandaan. Arthur en Ed zelf zijn zeer lieve, aangename mensen, heel erg gastvrij. Kortom, een echte aanrader!! Bedankt, Arthur en Ed, voor alles wat jullie voor ons gedaan hebben!! We hebben het heel erg geapprecieerd! Miet en Inge

Let me add to the chorus of superb reviews for this home and for the wonderful, caring hosts Art and Ed. They have thought of everything to make one’s stay memorable. The spotless bedroom had cable TV mounted over one of the beds, blackout shades over the windows, and even a “white noise” machine to lull you to sleep. The bathroom is wall-to-wall black marble and included brand new toothbrushes and an array of nice colognes. Art made sure that coffee was set up for brewing each morning, coupled with juice, bread, bananas and yogurt. When I arrived the first evening, Art and I sat around the kitchen table with glasses wine and had a great discussion about our backgrounds and about my plans to explore New York when my wife arrived the next morning. I corresponded with Art prior to my visit in order to get suggestions on where the locals go for restaurants. We were not in NYC long enough to try out his long list of places, but we did have a marvelous dinner right downstairs at the Red Cat restaurant and also tried his suggestion for a discrete after-theater place virtually unknown to tourists. Since our plans included a Broadway play on a rainy night, Art and Ed let us borrow a pair of opera glasses and umbrellas to keep us dry. If you are avid walkers, the location is perfect for exploring both mid-town via the High Line, the Chelsea Market, and also lower Manhattan. We did an enjoyable walk all the way downtown to the 9-11 museum. You will also notice that you are surrounded by great little art galleries. We were amazed at the rich collection of Picassos virtually around the corner at the Pace Gallery. In summary, we experienced the perfect combination of interaction with our hosts and freedom to come and go. You will not find more gracious, friendly and helpful hosts as Art and Ed. We can’t wait to go back!

Arthur and Ed were terrific hosts, just the right ratio of assistance, advice and respect for privacy, on both host and guest sides, with some fascinating local history thrown in for good measure. Location on the Highline @ 23rd was central to easy subway lines to get to midtown, upper east side or Brooklyn.
That said, room was very private, as was the bath, and the main floor parlor/atrium/dining room was lovely. Richest, most lusciously decorated Xmas tree I've ever seen. Wish I was the lucky recipient of some of those gorgeously wrapped presents beneath. Morning pot o coffee @ the push of a button and quiet time to reflect on your upcoming day in Manhattan. I'd sum up my stay there as effortless and intend to return.

My friend and I stayed with Ed and Art for a week the week before Christmas. From the initial booking right through to the day we left, our experience was nothing but exceptional! What a pleasure it was to stay with these two gentlemen in their absolutely gorgeous apartment in the heart of Chelsea. Extremely hospitable, caring, talkative without being intrusive and welcoming. 
The knowledge of the cool places to go was exceptional also. From art and culture places, cafes, restaurants, cocktail bars... Anything we wanted to see or do Art and Ed had some great tips which you won't find in the Lonely Planet guide. 
I got the flu for a couple of days and Ed whipped up his amazing chicken soup for me - which was simply amazing and such a kind hearted gesture. The location is away from the noise and intensity of Times Square but only 1-2 blocks from the Subway, a bus station across the road and a 20 minute walk to Broadway. 
In summary, Ed and Art are incredibly kind hearted and possibly the most hospitable people I have had the pleasure of meeting. It was certainly a pleasure to stay with them during our time in NYC.

Arthur and Ed could not have been any more welcoming and helpful. They genuinely care that your New York experience is the best it can possibly be. 
Upon arrival, you will be greeted and shown around the lovely space. Guidebooks, maps, pictures, and answers to any questions will be at the ready. The room itself is quite comfortable and looks out directly onto the Highline. Every detail seems to be thought of, including fresh coffee and continental breakfast in the mornings. We found the location central to everything of interest and easily accessible to both the bus and subway. The neighborhood is one of the best in New York, full of galleries and great restaurants. 
We have been to the city many times, but this visit will remain special to us because of these perfect accommodations. We plan on staying again for future vists and would not hesitate to recommend this listing to anyone looking to experience New York and feel right at home in the process.

I would recommend this place, Art and Ed lived up to all of the wonderful expectations that we got from previous feedback. 
In terms of location, safety, quietness and ambience this house gets a high mark. 
Would I say there again? I sure would. 
Loved it, loved the fireplace and just adored the location. Thanks again, Art, Ed, and PnC (your feline babies).

What can I say? After a seamless arrival into Manhattan  (thanks to the detailed info on the airbnb listing) we were warmly welcomed by Ed into their beautiful Chelsea apartment, offered a glass of wine and some food, then enjoyed a thoughtful tour of the apartment. The room and bathroom clean, tasteful, quiet and very comfortable. The shared kitchen very spacious with a unique view of the Highline.  The daily continental breakfast was an excellent way to start the day.  I have to say that although the amenities are perfect they do not surpass the hosts, Art and Ed!  We enjoyed every opportunity we had to talk to them. They are kind, intelligent, gracious and full of unique stories and excellent advice about their beloved city. We feel so fortunate to have stayed with them...I just cannot recommend their rental enough. Erin
Wonderful!!!

Ottima accoglienza e ottima esperienza, la prima con Airbnb! I due ragazzi sono stati molto gentili, efficienti e discreti, facilitando il nostro arrivo ed il nostro soggiorno di lavoro. La posizione è fantastica, il quartiere ben servito e vicino alla fiera, anche per questo torneremo volentieri le prossime volte! La casa è stupenda e, visto il freddo glaciale di questi giorni e il molto lavoro, è stato il nostro rifugio! Grazie  grazie!
Hosts made us feel very welcome. Description is accurate. This is my go-to space when I am in New York.

Arthur and Ed were amazing hosts!  We loved our stay in their very conveniently located, and lovely home in Chelsea.  We arrived in the evening and were warmly welcomed with a glass of wine and lots of great advice and information about visiting the city.  We had a full itinerary, but were able to recharge with a great night's sleep in very comfortable accommodation.   When we were preparing to leave,  Art and Ed helped us arrange very convenient transportation to the airport - we were well taken care of at all times.  We will be back for sure!  Thank you for a wonderful holiday in New York!

Manhattan's best kept secret?! Art and Ed are wonderful hosts. Attentive. Kind. Thoughtful. Entertaining. And funny!  This location is perfect- beautifully appointed, wonderfully calm and quiet yet close to everything that we wanted to visit. This was my fifth visit to New York and my first Airbnb. I will go back again and there is nowhere else I would rather stay. Art and Ed feel like home! Fabulous.

We loved staying with Art and Ed in their gorgeous place right on Highline Park. They are fabulous hosts and the description is spot on. We especially enjoyed the long talks we had with Art and Ed and (not to forget) the room, the breakfast and everything else..... 

So - thank you for a great time in New York! We will be back :-)

Everything was perfect. The photos are accurate, location amazing and well worth booking. The best part was meeting and chatting to art and Ed and sharing their knowledge and love of nyc. Would return in a heart beat.

Art and Ed were excellent hosts.  When we arrived Art enthusiastically gave us a lot of information on what to see and do in New York, and New York history.  Their location is excellent - next to the High Line, close to bus and subway access, and close to many restaurants.  We are planning to return to New York for another holiday in a couple of years, and we will stay with Art and Ed again.  New York is a great city and you need more than 5-6 days to see everything worth seeing.

Unser Aufenthalt war noch schöner als wir es nach den Bildern und der Beschreibung erwartet hatten!
Ed und Arthur sind die perfekten Gastgeber: charmant und gebildet, warmherzig und fürsorglich. Wir wurden nach unserer Ankunft mit einem Glas Wein empfangen und Ed hat uns viele interessante Informationen gegeben.
Das Apartment ist einem einem schönen alten Haus und nach Eds Plänen im Bauhausstil umgebaut worden. Sehr geschmackvoll und mit Kunstgegenständen bestückt.
Unser Zimmer war gemütlich, mit wundervollen Betten (wir haben besser als zu Hause geschlafen) und einem Blick direkt auf die Highline. Zimmer und Badezimmer waren blitzsauber.
Das Frühstück stand morgens bereit, war reichhaltig und lecker.
Die Lage ist äußerst günstig, in der Nähe von U Bahnlinien, Busse an der Ecke, Chelsea Market und Whitney  Museum zu Fuß zu erreichen - auf der Highline! Restaurants und Gallerien in der nächsten Umgebung.
Wir können uns kein schöneres "home away from home" vorstellen, nirgendwo.
Und unsere Gastgeber Ed und Arthur haben wir in`s Herz geschlossen!
Daniela und Heide aus Berlin

I am an NYC regular but new to airbnb.  Art and Ed were wonderful hosts to both me and my daughter.  The penthouse is gorgeous, clean and organized.  The guest area is just as described and includes little things like toothbrushes, shampoo, and a hair dryer.  Art and Ed are almost invisible, giving guests privacy, yet available for any questions or concerns. I highly recommend their space for travelers looking to feel safe and secure in NYC.

Dear Art and Ed,  thank you for making our holiday so perfect in every way.  Your warm welcome at midnight was just the beginning.  Staying with you in your beautiful apartment was amazing and your tips, knowledge and love for your city helped us to experience New York in a truly wonderful way, but more importantly we have made new friends who we hope to see again soon. Thanks again, Ros and I will miss you both.

I can not say enough good things about Ed and Art's place and their hospitality. Communication from getting to their place from the airport to recommendations on what to see and do in the city were fantastic. I'd highly recommend staying with them! I was there during the summer but my guess is their living room would be so cozy in the winter!!

Det var enkelt å finne frem til leiligheten og Arthur& Ed var hjemme da vi kom. Rommet var rent, pent og kjølig, noe vi satt stor pris på da New York var svært varmt. Rommet inneholdt også plass til å henge opp klær og stue vekk bagasjen. 
Vertene informerte oss om hvordan leiligheten fungerte og ga oss god informasjon om området rundt. Vi hadde et fantastisk opphold takket være den personlige servicen.

Nous avons passé un agréable séjour chez Arthur et Ed. Des hôtes parfaits, de précieux conseils, de bonnes discussions et toujours discrets. Une adresse à recommander. 

We had a wonderful stay in New York City thanks to Arthur and Ed. An address to recommended.

Wonderful hosts for our first visit to NY.  We were made to feel at home from the moment we arrived, and enjoyed our debriefing sessions with Art and Ed at the end of each day.  Excellent advice on places to eat, and things to see as well as on the history of the Chelsea district and NY overall
I loved staying with Arthur and Ed! They were a wealth of information and so very welcoming. I soon felt I was staying with friends, and in fact I do believe I have made some lovely new friends.

INCREDIBLY GREAT! This is honestly the best airbnb experience I've ever had. Living in Chelsea, right under the high line is like a dream come true. The place has prime location, amazing decorations, homely atmosphere, and exceptionally clean and comfortable rooms and bathrooms. The bathroom, especially, is like 5-star hotel level. Makes me speechless. But most importantly, the hosts Art and Ed are like the sweetest people in this planet. They're so nice and kind and taught me so much about this city and being a New Yorker. They really care about how guests feel. Their cats are great!! I enjoy walking on high line just next to the house, walking along the Hudson River at night and visit the Chelsea piers. And living here just makes me fall in love with the city and really feel how warm New York actually is. Marvelous 3 nights. I would love to visit again. :) <3

Art and Ed are the most genuine and lovely people I've ever had the pleasure to meet. I absolutely loved staying with them and only wish I could have stayed longer. They went out of their way to ensure I had everything I needed. Had fantastic suggestions of things to do, places to eat and drink. The area is beautiful, especially being so close to the high line which I used frequently to get to other parts of the city. Their apartment is absolutely incredible and spacious. I felt instantly at ease, Ed ad Art make you feel at home straight away. My first airbnb experience and I doubt it will ever be beaten. I hope to come back and visit them soon!

If you want to treat yourself to a fabulous NYC stay ... then stay with Arthur and Ed in Chelsea! The accomodation is stunning, the beds very comfy, the neigbourhood with the Highline just beautiful and the best about the location are the hosts Arthur and Ed. Both of them made our stay an experience that I would call "home away from home"! They are just amazingly lovely and welcoming!  Whatever help or information we needed - we received! I travelled with my 10 year old son and can only highly recommend staying with children at Ed & Arthur's place. My son and I were not only happy guests but also inspired by our conversations and the generosity towards us! This is definately a 5 star airbnb place!

J'ai passé une excellente semaine chez Ed et Arthur, je suis venu pour mon travail et j'ai été superbement accueilli, 
La propreté au rendez vous, l'appartement est très bien situé, près des bus, des stations de métro, le quartier est très agréable, juste derrière la High Line et des restaurant très sympa autour.
Ed et Arthur respecte votre autonomie tout en vous faisant sentir qu'ils sont la pour vous si vous avez besoin de quoi que ce soit.
Merci à tous les deux. Je recommande cette chambre sans restrictions.

My stay with Art and Ed was everything the previous reviews said.  They were charming, educated, helpful people and their apartment is great.  Chelsea is a very convenient place to stay and I saw as much as I could in my time In NYC.  I would be happy to come back and stay with them again if I come back to NY.  If you haven't been (Website hidden by Airbnb) prepared to walk your feet off!

Art and Ed were very warm and welcoming hosts. Art spent a considerable amount of time introducing us to the apartment which was impeccably furnished. We were able to make full use of the lounge and kitchen and there was a very good choice of food for breakfast each day. Art and Ed were a fund of local knowledge. As a result we saw places in New York which we may otherwise have missedq.  We were also able to use their washing machine and they could not have been kinder.

I will put it simply, this is my address any time I'm able to book it.
Quiet, Sophisticated, and the most gracious Hosts In New York City.
To experience this home is a chance to live in 
the Era of The City in another wonderful time!
Always feel welcome. The listing is accurate. Space is very comfortable. I am a repeat customer. This time they had my favorite bread: Ezekiel!!

选择住在Arthur & Ed的家,是这次纽约之行最大的收获之一,也是c最难忘的回忆之一｡
他们漂亮的家位于很方便的街区,离地铁站步行几分钟的距离,到各个景点都非常方便;楼下就有餐馆和24小时超市,从HIGHLINE一直走到哈德逊河畔,可以看到高楼大厦之外的纽约｡
Arthur & Ed很细心地给客人准备了地图,和我们讨论行程,给我们提供有用的信息和建议,和Arthur聊天是一件很愉快的事,如果再来纽约,我们还会考虑选择这里｡
————————————————————————
Our staying in Arthur & Ed's beautiful apartment is an amazing experience and one of the most unforgettable memories in NY.
It locates in an very convenient community which near the MTR station\Highline park\restaurants and 24-hours store.You can feel the other side of NY.
Arthur & Ed are very nice and welcoming hosts.They gave us a lot of helpful information and advises.If we go to NYC the next time,we would be happy to stay with them again.

Simply put, I would never want to stay anywhere else in NY. The place itself clean and GORGEOUS, honestly it looks even better in person. It's really easy to find and it's probably in the best location possible. Art was super kind and helpful and could probably tell you everything you ever wanted to know about anything. As two young women staying in NY, let me tell you, we felt SAFE and comfortable which was really important to me. It felt like a home. I only wish we could have stayed longer so I'd have had time to hang out in the lounge!

Nous avons passé une excellente semaine chez Arthur et Ed. L'appartement est confortable et exactement conforme à la description. Il est très bien situé : des restaurants et pubs à proximité pour les sorties du soir et la highline pour des nuits calmes ou pour les amateurs de jogging. Nous nous sommes sentis tout de suite à l'aise. Les rencontres avec Arthur et Ed avaient lieu plutôt en fin de journée, dans la cuisine, et permettaient d'échanger sur les visites du jour ou sur le programme à venir. L'accueil d'Arthur et Ed est chaleureux, simple et discret. Leurs conseils et "bons plans" pour la découverte de NYC sont précieux.

Es war der erste Aufenthalt mit airbnb und ich kann Arthur & Ed definitiv weiterempfehlen. 
Vor allem Arthur war von Anfang an sehr bemüht, sodass man sich sehr wohl fühlte. Unser Zimmer und Bad waren auf einer eigenen Etage, wodurch man seine Privatsphäre hatte. Lage des Apartments war super. Ein rundum gelungener Aufenthalt.

Arthur and Ed are wonderful hosts and their appartment is beautiful, a very cosy and trendy penthouse. You just feel at home.
The bedroom is very quite and you can see the highline outside, exceptional.
We highly recommend !

Being hosted by Arthur & Ed certainly made our trip to NYC ever more special. Their kindness and attention made us feel like home. Everything was perfect! Great location, very comfortable bed, quiet room with a view of the High Line Park. They received us with enthusiasm and gave us lots of tips about places and sights around NYC and they shared with us their love for this city.
I have stayed at Ed and Arthur's numerous times. They are always welcoming. I was greated this time by a beautifully decorated Christmas tree. Such a festive welcome.

Notre second séjour chez Arthur et Ed, l'accueil et toujours aussi chaleureux. C'est grâce à leurs précieux conseils que nous avons découvert un autre visage de New York, idéal pour une deuxième visite. Queen, Brooklyn....
Un grand merci pour vos attentions,votre  disponibilité et gentillesse.
Pat et Steph.

We were instantly made to feel welcome by Art who greeted us when we arrived. Both Art and Ed are great guys who are very knowledgable about the area. 
Everything was perfect, and exactly as described. Their place really is stunning, especially around Christmas...the tree is a sight to behold! The location was perfect...right on the high line walk and close to great restaurants, bars and Chelsea market. The transport links are great, with easy access to all the main sights. 
I'd recommend the room to anyone!

Arthur and Ed are GREAT hosts!  Their Superhost title is well deserved.  As long as they continue to share their home through Airbnb, I will never stay anywhere else again while in NYC!  Actually, they made my trip 100% much better and more fun!  They are both highly intelligent men who are easy to talk to about any subject; especially NYC.  I spent a week there, and could have sat and talked to them ALL day, if time allowed!  Their home is as beautiful as the photos, and the bed is very comfortable.  Transportation was convenient to get to around their area, and the Highline is a great place to walk and see more.  I will definitely recommend them to family and friends who visit NYC.

Art and Ed are truly deserved super hosts. They made me feel welcome from the moment I booked up until my departure. I highly recommend to follow their advice on near by restaurants, bakeries and sights. I loved the location and enjoyed overlooking the High Line from the bedroom window each day. You're in for a treat if you manage to get a booking with these lovely people!

This is a really sweet spot!!! Art & Ed's historic penthouse is enormous (truly huge by New York standards) and lavishly appointed with hotel-style bathrooms and gourmet kitchen. The location is unbeatable. It's a super hip area, and if you are walking north or south, you can take the Highline to get there.

Art & Ed's hospitality is off the charts! They are friendly, open, and they make a huge effort to be helpful and accommodating. We had some great chats, and they shared lots of great local knowledge. If they didn't already have a Superhost award, we would nominate them for sure!

My husband and I always stay with Art and Ed when we are in NY. They are wonderful hosts. Their home is conveniently located, always clean and comfortable, just a stone's throw from the High Line in Chelsea. This time we actually walked from Penn Station with our bags. It's not that far. Each time we needed a cab, we just walked downstairs and found one within minutes. They are both very knowledgeable about NY and points beyond. We were especially grateful for Art's tip to visit St. Augustine on our way to Savannah and Charleston. We will definitely stay with them any time we visit NY.

After spending the past six trips to NYC in Hotels, I have found Nirvana. Art and Ed’s home and neighborhood was safe, clean, and the location could not have been better for us. The Public Transport stop is 4 minutes from their home, and Art and Ed happily indulged us when we needed directions or information.  They are also so welcoming and were earnestly interested in making sure we were having a good time. They could not have been kinder or more accommodating to us. My sister and I were completely comfortable staying there, following their mantra of “this is your home for the week”. When in NYC I will Always stay with Art and Ed, if they will have me.
Stacee

De belles photos de la maison et de l'environnement qui étaient conformes à la réalité, très beau lieu chaleureux et nos hôtes charmants et accueillants tout en étant discrets. Nous recommandons cet endroit, nous étions proches de nombreux quartiers à visiter. Bref que du bonheur, Arthur parle un français parfait et du coup notre anglais était tout à fait minable, nous n'avons pas progressé sur cet aspect là mais nous allons faire des efforts, Ed nous a raconté des histoires sympas sur sa vie, nous aurions été heureuses de plus être en mesure d'échanger avec lui. Les deux chats sont aussi agréables, très chics et mystérieux. Nous allons communiquer l'adresse à notre famille qui va visiter New-York. Nous serons heureuses avec Camille d'accueillir Arthur et Ed pour un séjour en France.

We were welcomed warmly by Art despite being delayed 1 1/2 hrs beyond our arrival time.  After helping with our bags he gave us a great orientation to the neighborhood, suggesting several restaurants and things to do in the Chelsea area of Manhattan.  All the restaurants turned out to be very good, so we were very grateful for the advice. 
 Our week-end was wonderful, and the location for our activities on the West Side were just around the corner from the apartment!!   If we needed anything ( which we did not) Art and Ed were just a phone call away and sweet Kim was on site. It felt like we had the apt to ourselves, which was a real luxury!  Although our private bath was "down the hall" and not an en-suite, we were perfectly at ease with the arrangement.  
 Being on the high-line was great fun! And we loved the location.  If I had to find one thing in the "dislike" category, it would be the 1 1/2 flights of stairs to the apartment. That should not deter anyone -it's just an FYI.

My friend, Sue, and I had a grand 5 daystar in NewYork enhanced triple fold by staying in Arthur and Ed’s lovely, spacious, clean and aesthetically pleasing apartment. My achilles heel on holiday is always the pillow, not so here, it was PERFECT!

If you are walkers, the accommodation is within walking distance of most of the ‘sights’, we walked to Central Park from there, taking in the Flat Iron Building, Grand Central Station, EmpireState Building etc etc, as well as Greenwich Village but if you prefer public transport the area is well served with buses and the metro. There are a number of good restaurants within walking distance and Arthur has produced a list of recommendations.

Arthur gave us many useful tips about what to see and the quickest or most interesting ways of getting around. We enjoyed some social time with both Ed andArthur but they never intruded on our space or time.  I would, without doubt, stay there again, if they would have me!
Can't rate this place highly  enough. Great people and hosts, fantastic location couldn't ask for more. Thank you hope to see you again on our return.

I can't speak highly enough about Art & Ed and their generous hospitality & beautiful apartment. From the first communication to our farewell we felt welcomed and cared about.  Both have extensive knowledge of NY, history, unique sights,  great restaurants like only locals do & are very happy to share these with their guests. The location is great, a 10 minute walk to the subway or bus right outside. The Highline is literally outside the door and it's lovely to walk it. included breakfast is a great start to the day & laid out thoughtfully each night ready for the morning , beds & pillows are great quality & very comfortable, linen, towels are clean, fresh & were changed during our 12 day stay. The private bathroom is spacious & immaculately clean, as is the whole apartment, with a stock of essentials including a hairdryer . We didn't use the kitchen to cook in apart from making a cup of tea & late night snacks, but it had everything you would need to make a meal if you want. We were welcome to use the lounge room, very pleasant to sit in comfort to read or catch up on emails etc and not feel that you have to stay in the bedroom, There are restaurants & a couple of bars downstairs & many more within walking distance what ever type of food you're after, a 24 hr pharmacy opposite, a liquor store & a supermarket in the next block. Although the intersection of Tenth & 23rd is busy, the bedroom is at the back, not on the street & apart from the odd siren, the street noise didn't bother us at all. It is New York after all, it's a busy place all hours. We slept very well. And only one flight of steps, easily manageable, and we were helped up the stairs with our bags. We felt safe at all times, the building is secure and our privacy was respected always.  A wonderful stay with two lovely people, thanks so much Art & Ed.

My husband and I stayed in Art & Ed’s home for 12 days.  We found their hospitality and friendship exceptional which added to the wonderful time we spent in New York.  The apartment was fabulous as shown on their site, extremely well equipped with all you could possibility need, spotlessly clean, comfortable beds.    Breakfast was supplied, we didn’t cook during our stay but we had the use of a full kitchen.  Excellent location close to buses and subway, restaurants (The Red Cat was excellent especially the Tempura Green Beans), groceries and the apartment abuts the High Line.  Early morning walks on the High Line to Chelsea Market were great, especially enjoying the Ninth Street Coffee in the market.

We can’t speak highly enough of Art and Ed “Super Hosts Extraordinarine”, extremely generous in all aspects of our stay and willing to share their knowledge/history of New York.  Art & Ed provided a comprehensive document detailing places to visit and excellent restaurants which all added to a wonderful experience.  We would love to revisit New York and would definitely like to stay with Art and Ed again.  Art & Ed’s belief in Airbnb is that it is a community for sharing experiences. There is no doubt they live up to this and were pleased to hear about our experiences as well.

Absolutely loved my stay with Art & Ed! They were so accommodating and my friend and I felt right at home. The apartment was epic and very clean and quiet. Exactly what we needed on our busy trip. We will definitely book again! Thanks so much!

Arthur & Ed are so wonderful hosts! We were impressed by their welcome and gentleness and consideration very much. Their house is an ideal place of New York that we image. The good interior and art of the sense are also lovely. Of course it is very comfortable and clean! They explained recommended sightseeing places of New York to us in detail. We were able to thereby have a splendid experience. However, the memory that is the most splendid for us is the conversation with them and staying at their house. We want to go to NYC again to visit Arthur & Ed.

Exceeded our expectations ! Arthur and Ed are amazing hosts, welcoming and informative. Immediately felt at home and fully informed when we met Arthur, he provided us with a lot of information and took time to understand our plans for the trip. 
The private room was perfect, amazing view of the highline. Bathroom was brilliant and well equipped. The fact that we were able to use the kitchen and living room was great as the apartment itself is fantastic, all the facilities you could need and more. Location is excellent two blocks away from Subway, couple of minutes walk to access Highline which we used a lot. From this location we felt we had an ideal start point to do all the exploring we wanted. The area felt very safe and had lots of local services, shops,  bars and restaurants. Highly recommend the Half King bar and restaurant which we visited a few times and is two minutes away.
We were out a lot but were lucky one night to spend some time with Ed and Arthur, very interesting and open hosts and we had a great time with them, and I would love to meet them again.

So if your thinking about booking this accommodation I can only say go for it and you will not be disappointed.

Thanks for a fantastic stay guys and hope one day our paths cross again.
Robin

Art and Ed were exceptional hosts! My friend and I felt so welcome in their home and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Their house is beautiful and the room we stayed in was clean and spacious. The private bathroom is wonderful and such a lovely convenience too. The location is perfect - close to the subway and right on the highline! Ed and Art provided great suggestions for things to see and do, as well as great restaurant and food options. When I'm back in NYC, I will definitely be coming back to stay here!
My friend and I both remarked that it was one of the best Airbnb experiences we've ever had!

Ed and Art are warm, responsive and well-prepared hosts and their place is the most amazing comfy clean spacious artistic well-decorated centrally-located penthouse apartment in all of New York City. They communicated well and clearly about checkin; they provided clean linens and brand new *individually wrapped* toothbrushes (Ed is a Dentist so I guess dental hygiene is a passion of his); coffee, cereal and fresh fruit were laid out every morning; and they each told me neighborhood tips and interesting anecdotes. Ask Ed to show you the view from the roof!

I had a wonderful stay with Ed and Art.  They were extremely helpful and hospitable, particularly as I arrived late and stayed on during my last day.  The room is small but very comfortable and the location is absolutely brilliant.  I would recommend staying here and hope to do so in the future when I next come to New York.

It was a wonderful time staying at Arts and Eds Apartment. They were very friendly, and if you had any questions or problems, you could ask them for advice. You notice, that they are really interested in your wellbeing.
I would definitely recommend the AirBnb Hosts.
You couldn't do anything wrong, if you stay there.
Many many thanks to Art and Ed, Alex and Stefan

Art and Ed met us at the door, showed us around the apartment, left breakfast items out in the open, provided a list of good places to eat lunch and dinner. Offered information on places to visit and where to go to get to the subway, bus and taxis. Room was very adequate for our needs, temperature in the house was very comfotable. We spent considerable time in conversation and found them pleasant and knowledgeable onamny topics including art and local history. It was a wonderful experience and will definitely stay again if the timing works out.

Arthur accueille et répond efficacement à toutes les questions des visiteurs.  L'appartement est calme, vaste, très bien placé. 
Literie d'excellente qualité. 
Salle de bain du bas attenante à la chambre des visiteurs. 
Petit déjeuner complet à disposition le matin. 
Séjour fantastique. 
On dit Merci et on dit Bravo !

Arthur and Ed were so welcoming for our entire visit! Right from the moment I booked our reservation Art was corresponding via text setting up the details of our arrival. Their place is SO beautiful and comfortable and they pulled out all the stops, from stocked toiletries in the bathroom to coffee and fruit in the kitchen.  They know so much about the history of Manhattan and have a booklet at the ready for their guests with sites to check out as well as best places to eat all over the city.  I hope to book every future trip to Manhattan with Arthur and Ed!

Art and Ed are welcoming and gracious. They are also VERY knowledgable about the area and transportation. The location and communication could not have been better and we highly recommend them as hosts. Their home is comfortable and has plenty of space for privacy if you so choose. A very satisfied customer!!

Art and Ed are the consumate airbnb hosts!  They are gracious, hospitable, helpful and all around nice guys.  During our stay one of us got a cold and Ed made home made chicken soup!  They are not just super hosts, they are super nova hosts.  Best airbnb experience ever thanks to the hosts!  Accomodations are as described.   Their home is perfect layout for room rental experience with access to common areas including a fully equipped kitchen.  Great neighborhood right in the heart of Chelsea near Highline. Would plan a trip to NYC again based on their availability.

Arthur & Ed are the perfect hosts so very helpful and accommodating and their knowledge of NYC is second to none I'm sure. Their apartment is spacious, clean and lovely, although we spent little time there (who stays in when in NYC) it was great to have use of a kitchen and living room instead of being confined to ones room. Art was kind to even do some washing for us.
Location is fabulous, very central and we managed to walk to most areas. 
We would recommend the high line to stay whilst in NYC.

Stayed at Arthur & Ed's apartment for four days in September. They were the perfect hosts with the perfect apartment in a perfect location of New York. 

The apartment is, quite simply beautiful. It is spotlessly clean and very comfortable. We had permission to use the kitchen at any time throughout our stay. The breakfast they supplied each morning, was a very generous gesture by Arthur & Ed, and very much appreciated. They also provided us with lots of very useful information on local attractions, restaurants, transport in and around New York and the Chelsea area also. They were very interesting to chat with, and engaged in conversations with us very easily. We truly enjoyed their company. 

This is the first time that I have used Airbnb where the owner is living in the property I have rented during my time there. So I was nervous before I arrived as to how this would work. However, I need not have worried at all. They are indeed super hosts. Arthur & Ed also like their privacy and the space within the apartment allows for everyone to have privacy if they want it.

We would have absolutely no hesitation in recommending this apartment to anyone who is thinking of travelling to New York and looking for somewhere to stay.

We will definitely return again. We wouldn't want to stay anywhere else except Arthur & Ed's penthouse on 10th Avenue.  Thank you both for making our trip to New York such a wonderful experience.

Art and Ed were very gracious and helpful hosts. Their home is beautiful and located with very convenient access to the high line. The room was private and perfect for me. The bathroom is private and nearby. Having the ingredients for a light breakfast each morning was extremely helpful.

Art & Ed were great hosts and made us feel at home immediately. The apartment was very nice, with a lovely well decorated living room. The location is fantastic, with nice galleries and restaurants. They had such vast knowledge of New York and recommended all of the best places to go in the neighborhood. I can't imagine staying in another place whenever I go to New York again.
I think I did that already

We had a great week in NYC, Art and Ed were perfect hosts. We enjoyed the location including the breakfast very much. As it's directly next to the High Line, we took the chance to start and end our days with a walk on the High Line. We would come back!

Dieses war unser 1. airbnb Aufenthalt und er kann nicht getoppt werden! Arthur und Ed sind sehr herzlich, immer ansprechbar, hilfsbereit und da selbst äußerst reiseerfahren, wissen sie ganz genau, was man sich wünscht, wenn man im Ausland übernachtet. Selbst der eigene Bademantel gehört zu den Details, die den Aufenthalt bei Arthur und Ed so besonders machen. Wir wurden empfangen wie Freunde und haben uns wie zu Hause gefühlt. Arthur war bei unserer Ankunft da und hat sich viel Zeit genommen, uns alles zu erklären und uns mit unglaublich guten Tipps versorgt. Auch eine Reservierung in Restaurant "The Red Cat", welches im Hause ist und wo man normalerweise Monate im voraus reservieren muß, war für Ed kein Problem. Da wir morgens die Küche und das Wohnzimmer für uns hatten, konnten wir in Ruhe frühstücken und den Tag in dem herrlichen, sonnendurchfluteten Wohnzimmer starten. Bei Ed und Arthur fühlt man sich gut betreut, willkommen und es ist immer die richtige Balance zwischen "... wir sind für Euch da" und ".... wir lassen Euch in Ruhe". Wie gesagt, das ist sehr schwer zu toppen. Wir freuen uns immer auf zu Hause, aber diese Mal hätten wir länger bleiben können.

Art e Ed se colocaram a disposição, nos deram seus celulares e estavam ao alcance se precisássemos. Mas não precisamos porque tudo estava perfeito. O quarto é melhor do que aparece nas (Website hidden by Airbnb) 2 grandes janelas tínhamos vista sobre o Highline . Sempre deixavam tudo arrumado para nosso café da manhã  e so precisávamos colocar a louça na máquina. A cozinha é ampla e estava a nossa disposição e tivemos a impressão de morar no Chelsea. Em cima do Red Cat, ao lado de uma galeria de Arte e do Highline tivemos uma experiência única de New York, como verdadeiras Nova Iorquinas. Voltaremos com certeza.

My sister Beth and I had a wonderful four day stay with Art and Ed in their lovely Chelsea penthouse.  It offers the best of all possible worlds with a well-appointed private bed/bath combined with the use of the kitchen and comfy living room space.  The location was ideal for our New York visit - easy walking to many of our destinations as well as access to lots of nearby transportation options.  Art and Ed are both such generous hosts, always willing to share their wealth of NY knowledge.   Thanks also to Castor and Pollux for sharing "their" couch ;-)   Highly recommended!  We hope to return.

This was my first time renting a room, and I couldn't have been luckier. Art and Ed were absolutely lovely! Art was quick to respond and helped me in every way possible.  

Overall, the apartment is a beautiful space, filled with art. Apropos, considering that the location is conveniently located around the corner from all the galleries—a perfect location for art lovers. They had a huge Christmas tree in the living room, which made the place feel warm and festive. The room and private bathroom was well-appointed with all the necessities. They even had bathrobes! 

Overall, my experience was A+. I would definitely stay here again when I'm back in the city. Highly recommended!

This house was right next to the High Line Park. The location is great for gallery going, restaurants, and the Whitney Museum. Their house is 2 blocks from subway; makes getting anywhere very easy. This was our first airbnb experience and it was a great introduction to the process. Would certainly stay with Arthur and Ed again. We were made to feel comfortable in their home and they offered local knowledge that would be impossible to get in any other manner. Our stay with Arthur and Ed was a perfect mix of accommodation into their home, sharing their experiences when helpful, and making us comfortable in doing our own thing as well. Their house is very large for NYC and the private bedroom and bath we used was perfect for our needs (a married couple). Highly Recommended!

We stayed for a week in Art and Ed's beautiful home. We were made to feel very welcome and enjoyed laughing with and chatting to Art around the kitchen table over a glass of wine or a coffee. Art and Ed were full of interesting and useful information about Manhattan, and the immediate neighbourhood of Chelsea. The location is fabulous - easy to access downtown or uptown Manhattan. We started most mornings setting off on The High Line on our adventures! 
There was always a roaring fire to greet us when we got in after a long day walking, shopping, sightseeing, eating and drinking. 
There's no place like New York at Christmas time,  and there's no place like Art and Ed's for comfort, a warm friendly welcome, and superb hospitality. We'd like to think  we've made new friends and would love to return sometime.

I've staid with Art and Ed for a second time during a business trip in NY. It's like staying with friends who make you feel extremely welcome and accommodate all my needs. They provide great insights on  local news and surrounding area and provide great tips for restaurants and what to do nearby. It's a fantastic location for art lovers who want to check out local galleries or visit The Whitney and the Highline. Those coming to attend an event at the Jacob K. Javits centre can get there easily on foot, avoiding the hunt for taxis when trade shows finish. Thanks for making me feel so welcome again. x
Great location, very clean place, hosts are very helpful with suggestions on where to eat and visit

Nous avons tout aimé... mais aussi la gentillesse la finesse la disponibilité les attentions d'Arthur et Ed
Que dire de la parfaite maîtrise de la langue Française d'Arthur
Merci

Making a trip to NYC? The choice where to stay is easy! This is the place you would love to stay! Art and Ed's place is so much more than just a place to stay! It is a home where you will be welcomed with open arms, conversations about America, history, travel and food. A real New York experience where you get to meet and learn from the New Yorkers. I cannot recommend Art and Ed's place enough! 
Being next to the High Line is an interesting experience - you literally get to experience being a part of it ... The location in Chelsea is great and makes a good base to explore NYC. 
So go ahead and treat yourself to an unforgettable experience and stay with Art and Ed!
Arthur and Ed were so nice, and they gave us so many advises which make our first trip to New York very easy. 房东非常好,给我们很多意见,让我们旅行更轻松｡真的,选这里没错的｡

Dear Art and Ed, having you host our first AirBnB stay was just the best thing that could have happened! I think your place is better than any hotel you could ever stay in. The seperate beds, the lovely bedroom, own bathroom an all those little details, the breakfast setup, the extra tooth brushes, I could go on... But the most important experience was meeting you two! I could have listened to your fabulous life experiences forever and I can imagine spending nights with you over discussing world politics with a good glass of wine. Travelling is made of who you meet. You made this trip very special! Would love to keep in touch! My offer is still in place: Please visit us in Stuttgart any time! my dearest regards, Sonja

We stayed for a week and couldn't have been luckier. Not only is the apartment breathtaking with direct view on High Line it's also perfectly located in a charming neighborhood with two bus lines right in front of the house and the tube just two blocks away. But what really made our stay so outstanding was the warmth and kindness of Art and Ed. They made us feel like being their friends and have an incredible knowledge of New York. I could have listened to them for hours. There was always time for a chat or discussion about what ever was in our mind. We felt like home and will come back for sure!

This is the place. Seriously, look no further. We could not have possibly chosen a better place to stay, location in the city, or better hosts. ESPECIALLY if this is your first time to the city, Arthur and Ed are so incredibly helpful. They're so prepared for their guests, with lists of suggested things to see/do and food to eat. Some of the best food we had while in the city we would have never known about without their suggestions. They were also very helpful in figuring out the public transportation system, which was SO easy to use from their place. Art encouraged us to text him with any questions throughout our stay, and he responded every time, usually within just a couple minutes, to help us out with suggestions or transportation questions. I wouldn't even consider staying anywhere else, just book this one now :-)

We had a great stay at Arthur's place. The room is comfortable and quiet which you don't find that often in NYC. Arthur was great in communicating with us, being flexible with our schedules and providing great tips on places to hang out. Will definitely stay here again!

I stayed here while in town for a trade show. The location could not have been better and the highline made the walk to the show so much more enjoyable. There are many great places to eat and a CVS right across the corner. Art and Ed were wonderful hosts. They offered many suggestions that never let us down. Their place is beautiful, very clean and super comfortable. I would return for the lovely stay but also for their fun company!

Tout est parfait chez Arthur et Ed! La description reflète la réalité en tous points, la chambre donne au calme sur la high line donc pas de bruits pour dormir. L appart est bien situé pour accéder aux transports en commun, c est parfait pour découvrir la ville. On se sent " à la maison" tout de suite à l'accueil, la disponibilité et la gentillesse d Ed et Arthur. Leurs conseils et leur sélection de sites, de restos sont une mine d or! N hésitez pas

The location is unbeatable and the company is fantastic!  Art and Ed are very knowledgeable about the ins and outs of NYC and have a lot of insight to offer. They were amazing hosts - kind, considerate, thoughtful, helpful and more. I highly recommend staying here for your next trip to the city.

A beautiful home in a perfect location.  As much privacy as we needed or wanted.  Central to everything from the theatre district to the Village.  A great place to stay for a vacation and much more affordable than a hotel.

Great place and close to transport and restaurants. Great location. True to description. Would highly recommend. Extremely helpful hosts. Good value. One flight of stairs to carry suitcases but Arthur did this but it was not expected.

A lovely welcoming home, more spacious than I expected in NYC.  My (adult) son and I shared a room, but with a full kitchen and other areas available to us, we were quite comfortable and never crowded.  And our hosts were welcoming if we wanted info or just to chat, but we also felt comfortable staying to ourselves.  This was an amazing first-time airbnb experience

LOCATION: right next to the beautiful Highline Park, a scenic (check out the architecture) short walk to subway, surrounded by bus stops, in the heart of gorgeous Chelsea - you won't be disappointed! Mum and I felt perfectly safe travelling to and from at all hours of the day and night. 
FOOD: We loved having so many great options for eating out right at our doorstep. Art and Ed kindly provided us with coffee and breakfast items and also recommended some awesome places to eat lunch and dinner. If you're lucky, they might even whip up their signature dishes for you - Ed, I'm still thinking about that Navy bean soup :) 
OUR ROOM: oh so comfy beds, perfect temperature, quiet (even though there was renovations happening in the building we didn't hear a thing), TV was great to chill out to, a big plus was power points everywhere for us to charge our gear, sufficient wardrobe space and the bathrobes were a lovely touch! We slept like babies. 
BATHROOM: Spotless, clean, our own space to use with everything we needed right next to our room which was super handy. 
KITCHEN: Personally, I loved this space the most as it was the hub of Art & Ed's place. A light filled, clean cozy area to have breakfast while watching people walk the highline, recount the day/night adventures to Art & Ed and if you're deemed acceptable, play with Castor & Pollux (the tabbies). Got my mum's stamp of approval for clean & tidy too :)
LOUNGE: We used the kitchen area mostly but we loved the soft music in the lounge as we came home.  
ART & ED: Talk about raising the bar - my mum's bucket list trip to NYC was made extra special by these two stand-out hosts. Genuine care for our need for space and a willingness to interact with us, share their stories and listen to ours really helped us to connect with the new Manhattan. Art's communication from the start reassured us that things were organised! Art was instrumental in prioritising our sight-seeing (the UN tour & The MET rooftop was a great tip) - he's just a wonderfully kind person that we are so grateful to have met :) Ed is full of awesome stories and I wish we had more time to chat!! Thanks for the movie too Ed :) Castor & Pollux - the space wouldn't be fun without these gorgeous creatures. I'm not a cat person but I loved these two. They keep to themselves and are immaculately clean. 

VALUE: If you're looking for the best of NYC & Airbnb combined, you can't go wrong with these hosts. Can't recommend highly enough.
Simply a wonderful experience and highly recommendable !  It could not have been better.

Hard to know where to begin because everything was so perfect.
Arthur and Ed have a beautiful penthouse in a quiet area of Chelsea. Close to public transport and just next to the Highlife park (which I highly recommend!). You really feel like a friend place instead of an Airbnb what is really appreciable.
I can't say anything about cleaness because cleaner come before each stay.
Arthur and Ed wrote a paper with all sites to visit in Manhattan. The paper is about 50pages. At this you should add all their advices and hacks! We followed their recommendations and our small 3days trip was so perfect!
I'm not highly recommend to stay at their place, I would say you'll miss something if you're not going at their place!
Wish you all the best for the future and thanks again for everything.

What can we say... we've had a n amazing stay with Artur, Ed and their 2 cats! 

++ communication and support/advice for our stay (thanks Arthur and Ed!!), perfect balans privacy/interesting conversations, great spot (subway and bus nearby), breathtaking house, simpel but good breakfast, own fridge, good blinds, quiet bedroom because the bedroom is at the Highline...I could go on and on... thanks also to the former guests who leaved their subwaycards for us!

-- we had to go home ;)

We can absolutely recommend this great place!

This was my second stay at Art and Ed's and it was great from start to finish.
