No eating and loitering in Living room area 4. STRICTLY No smoking at all times on our premises including pati
neighborhood_overview: Located between four (4) major intersections, Atwater and Guy, St. Jacques and St. Antoine with walking distance between St. Catherine and The Lachine Canal. Safe residential area on tree-lined street, very close to metro (orange line), area quiet for sleeping and with direct connection to Old Montreal and Convention Center.
notes: Private room has 3 beds (2 double, 1 bunk), this room sleeps maximum 3 guests. Important notes: 1. The living spaces are equipped with surveillance cameras: (Dinning room, Living room and front door). 2. BATHROOMS: TOWELS, PERSONAL SOAPS AND BELONGINGS must be brought back to your room. Other guests would greatly appreciate this.
transit: Walking is very easy with access to most major attractions. Metro in only 3 minute walk from property.
access: 1. Private room 2. Guest mini-fridge in common room area 4. Access to two (2) full bathrooms with showers
interaction: Guests are always friendly and welcome discussions from host and other guests.
house_rules: - Please be respectfull of other guests on the premises.. Please remove shoes and boots before entering the property. We offer slippers for your comfort and convenience. - Check-in: after 3pm - Check-out: before 11am - - - Policies, Conditions and Payment Options - - - Vacation / Executive property rental begins at 3 P.M. on your first rental date and ends at 11 A.M. on your final rental date. - - - Smoking is prohibited within the home itself. No more than two (2) guests per room. No pets allowed. The living spaces are equipped with surveillance cameras. - - - All rooms are pre-cleaned before arrival. We do no charge a housekeeping fee for your stay. - - - Property rental reservations must be made by way of  VISA, MASTERCARD, or AMERICAN EXPRESS. - - - Cancellation Policy - - - We will be happy to REFUND both your rental deposit and your damage deposit should you need to cancel your booking for whatever reason. Failure to provide no less than a 14 day cancellation notice PRIOR TO THE

host.host_about: I'm service-oriented, open-minded, athletic, international individual, well traveled with many interests and passions in life. Looking forward to meeting you and  providing you and yours a comfortable, relaxing and memorable experience throughout your visit.

name: Modern top floor unit in Brookvale, close to beach
summary: A light, modern unit in the heart of the Northern Beaches. Two large bedrooms (one with large ensuite), one queen bed, one double and both with memory foam mattresses. Two bathrooms and open plan kitchen with oven, blender, juicer, Nespresso machine, dishwasher & microwave.  Please note - second bedroom has a cot available for babies/toddler. FREE WIFI, FOXTEL & NETFLIX
space: Views of Curl Curl beach, Manly castle & the City!
description: A light, modern unit in the heart of the Northern Beaches. Two large bedrooms (one with large ensuite), one queen bed, one double and both with memory foam mattresses. Two bathrooms and open plan kitchen with oven, blender, juicer, Nespresso machine, dishwasher & microwave.  Please note - second bedroom has a cot available for babies/toddler. FREE WIFI, FOXTEL & NETFLIX Views of Curl Curl beach, Manly castle & the City! All areas Available if needed, otherwise we'll leave you to it. Manly is 15 mins away on the bus, Dee Why with bars and restaurants 10 mins on bus. Ocean is 10 mins drive away.....enjoy! FREE street parking available and five minute walk to the main bus route of the Northern Beaches.  Manly 15 mins bus ride away, Palm Beach 45 min bus ride.  Great location for Manly, the Mall and Freshwater/Curl Curl beach. The spare room has a cot & change table you are welcome to use.
neighborhood_overview: Manly is 15 mins away on the bus, Dee Why with bars and restaurants 10 mins on bus. Ocean is 10 mins drive away.....enjoy!
notes: The spare room has a cot & change table you are welcome to use.
transit: FREE street parking available and five minute walk to the main bus route of the Northern Beaches.  Manly 15 mins bus ride away, Palm Beach 45 min bus ride.  Great location for Manly, the Mall and Freshwater/Curl Curl beach.
access: All areas
interaction: Available if needed, otherwise we'll leave you to it.
house_rules: When you leave please leave keys on kitchen bench and ensure the door is locked behind you. Please keep noise to a minimum after midnight on the balcony.  We just ask that you take your shoes off at the door (damn cream carpets!) and that you leave our home the way you found it.  No smoking and sorry no pets. Apart from that - make yourself at home!

host.host_about: Positive, outgoing, social family. Have a little one called Max that keeps us busy!

reviews.comments:
My friends and me had here a perfect time over christmas and NYE!

Jo have a really beautiful and cosy home with 2 bed- and bathrooms, a big balcony with a BBQ and a great view over Brookvale/Manly. 
And she is so helpful and very friendly!

Because Jo was not in town, her awesome mother in law gave us the key. We were allowed to check in at 8am because our bus arrived earlier and we were also allowed to check out later - she is really helpful and straightforward, too! 

The busstation to Sydney CBD is only a few minutes away and the bus takes about 30-45 min.
The wifi is good and Jo has a lot of DVDs for the TV as well. 

The apartment situated on a big hill;  great for views, but tiring with suitcases! ;)

We where thrilled and we can highly recommend this apartment ..we would love to come back one time.
The boys really enjoyed their stay in the apartment, great value for money and so close to the shopping centre!  Jo was flexible with check in and a great communicator.  Thanks again Jo!
Great generous hosts. We'll miss it (hope to be back one day)  Very comfy and homily.  A nice Soft Landing for us :)

Me and my friends who stayed here had such a wonderful time over New Years and a big part of that was Jo’s place. Before arrival Jo was so helpful in sending through information in what could be done in the immediate surrounding area.

Due to time restraints we couldn’t do everything but we certainly had a go at and discovered some little gems we other wouldn’t have known about.

The place itself was cosy and had a lovely warmth to it. Everything that we expected for our stay was met and exceeded. The accommodation of an early check in given the long flight in was especially appreciated.

Highly recommended. Thanks for everything!

Jo has a lovely place in a beautiful location. close to public transport and easy for us with a car to get around. beaches and shops very close by. Jo was very quick to respond with any questions and very helpful and welcoming. Would gladly stay again.
Wonderful place for our weekend stay, thank so much Jo!

Very compact apartment. A bit small for four adults plus luggage. As this is someone’s home, there is little space to put your own things. Nice to have two bathrooms though.
It is up a very steep hill in one of Sydney’s suburbs . You do need a car but you can walk to the main road to get buses etc. We were there over a heatwave at New year and being a top floor unit, it was very warm. There are fans but no A/C. Jo had left things in the fridge for us to use, plus some beers which were appreciated and was always contactable to answer any questions.

name: BEDROOM PRIVATE COMFY NEAR 6 TRAIN NO CURFEW
summary: One block from the 6 train. Clean private room in colorfulart house located in a very unique, safe, party atmosphere area. Super diverse with all types of wonderful restaurants, latino dance club local hot spots. Close to Bronx Zoo & Botanical Gardens. 30min>Central Park, 45min 9/11 Memorial. Walking distance we have Macy's, kmart, hardware, pizza, diner, pharmacy's, restaurant's, clubs, discount stores, super markets, ihop, sporting goods, etc... Thanks 4 looking @ our listing :)
space: Clean room with Smart TV & remote control, small desk, chair, waste basket, shelving unit, window, quiet fan, fresh sheets, towel, hair dryer, iron and air conditioner. Central heating, floor heater available if more heat is needed.
description: One block from the 6 train. Clean private room in colorfulart house located in a very unique, safe, party atmosphere area. Super diverse with all types of wonderful restaurants, latino dance club local hot spots. Close to Bronx Zoo & Botanical Gardens. 30min>Central Park, 45min 9/11 Memorial. Walking distance we have Macy's, kmart, hardware, pizza, diner, pharmacy's, restaurant's, clubs, discount stores, super markets, ihop, sporting goods, etc... Thanks 4 looking @ our listing :) Clean room with Smart TV & remote control, small desk, chair, waste basket, shelving unit, window, quiet fan, fresh sheets, towel, hair dryer, iron and air conditioner. Central heating, floor heater available if more heat is needed. Shared bathroom. Kitchen available. You can use kitchen at any time.  We are not bothered with some noise at any time of the day, we all work different shifts. Our common area is very small but you are welcome to hang out. You can smoke outside, if it is to cold to smoke outside y
neighborhood_overview: Unique party atmosphere neighborhood, wonderful affordable restaurants from all over the world, Safe area, fun latino club local popular spots, mini market just across the street.
notes: you will be sharing the house with 3 other people.
transit: We are one block away fro the 6 train our station is St. Lawrence station. We do not have private parking.
access: Shared bathroom. Kitchen available. You can use kitchen at any time.  We are not bothered with some noise at any time of the day, we all work different shifts. Our common area is very small but you are welcome to hang out. You can smoke outside, if it is to cold to smoke outside you can smoke in our entry way (leave front door a bit open and close the second door).
interaction: Please inform us of any condition that may require disclosure in case of required aid etc....
house_rules: Please pick-up after yourself after using any common areas. No bothering or hurting anyone, No breaking or steeling,  No Guests, No nudity,  Please note that we do not get bothered easily. No hard drugs or substances that may turn you into the incredible hulk lol....

host.host_about: Busy NY artist originally from LA. I show my work in various places within the city. I am patient and easy to get along with. My life motto is Love and Live....

reviews.comments: I am very happy to say that I was Alicia's first Airbnb Guest! She was very welcoming and helpful. The room was very clean and it had a small desk, lamp and a closet. Along the halls of her house and even in the room she has her artwork hanging. There are many things in her are and she is very close to the train which is a plus. I would recommend it to anyone and everyone.
PERFECT and the BEST HOST..She comes pick up me at metro station at 11pm..I recommend her..Apartment was exactly as described.
Great small room for the price! Alicia was very accommodating.

consegui la habitacion por airbnb,,todo era excelente tal cual en la foto, muy amable la sra alicia te hace sentir como a un hijo, todo limpio y ordenado, facil acceso al metro a pocos metros de distancia, de volver a ir me quedaria de nuevo alli,,,gracias por todo
Amazing experience the host was exceptional .  They made you feel at home.  I would recommend this place to so many people.

It was for me pleasure to meet somebody like Alicia. Very friendly person. 
Room, adequate to the price. Was enough good for me. Real bed, desk and "wardrobe" - that all what I wanted and I got it.

Alicia und ihr Mann sind 2 ganz nette, hilfsbereite, unkomplizierte und offene Gastgeber. Die Wohnung ist ca. 30min. von Downtown gelegen, aber gut mit der Bahn zu erreichen, welche sich keine 5 Minuten fussläufig von der Wohnung befindet. 
Die Bronx würde ich als Alleinreisende Frau mit europäischem Aussehen, zumindest abends nicht unbedingt empfehlen, auch wenn grundsätzlich die Nachbarschaft sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit war.

Alicia is such a lovely person , she made me feel like I'm home the moment I arrived. Though it's just a short stay , im glad I picked her place. The room is just as pictured so whoever booked her place will have your own privacy. Once again thanks for having me Alicia!

The apartment is good value for money, very comfortable bed and the desk in the room came in handy. Alicia is very a welcoming and kind host. She tries to make her guests feel as at home as possible whilst allowing you to have your own space.
Alicia met me when I arrived and showed me my bedroom and common areas. This was exactly what I was looking for - very comfortable and convenient. A great experience!

This was by far the best Airbnb experience yet. Check-in was simple, right off of the train line. Alicia and her husband were there and welcomed me immediately and gave me some great tips about getting around. The place was clean, warm, and the bed was comfy. I almost forgot: Thank you for my welcome shot! During Halloween Alicia invited me to a Los Muertitos celebration and I had a blast. This host was the sweetest I have ever seen, and I look forward to coming back!
It was a great experience! Had no trouble finding the place. She was a wonderful host!

Alicia was very welcoming and helpful.
The room is as it is described.
Alicia is like my sister from another mister!!  We are so much alike. She's very nice her place is clean and hospitable. I loved my stay with her!  She's a new friend!
Alicia wasn't home during my stay due to her being out of town, but her husband was there and made my stay very enjoyable. Would recommend this room to anyone.
Alicia was a very hospitable and warm host. Good area of the Bronx right next to the subway.
Although i never saw Alicia, everything worked well. The neighborhood is quite and it is really near to the metro. There are a lot of places where you can get something to eat.

I almost did not choose to stay because it was far from Manhattan. But I think it was worth it - groceries and bars within 5 minutes walk. Quite neighborhood. Excellent hosts. Very kind hosts - gave me enough personal space and were willing to share local tips.

Alicia was an outstanding host. She was very hospitable and accommodating. She creates beautiful artwork that adds a mesmerizing aesthetic to the place and she is very attentive to the needs and interests of her guests. I had never visited the city for more than a few hours, so I didn't know much about it, besides what I had heard. She made many suggestions of places to go and things to do. I would recommend this space to anyone who wants to have a pleasant experience upon visiting NYC.

I stayed 4 weeks in this room and Alicia was present only the last week. But she took care that her husband was present on my arrival. She is very lively and concerned that everything was ok. The room is as in the picture: small, in a semi-basement. Be aware that the place is dark and the small window cannot be opened (fresh air through the fan of the AC only). There are non common area to speak of. Be aware that the kitchen is under video camera, if you feel uncomfortable with it. 
The area is safe and extremely calm (besides loud music upstairs during the week end, which was fine for me). Very close to the 6 line, 45 mn to Union Square. Shopping facilities more than enough for daily needs.
The host made me feel at home, she is an anazing artist and did not bother me at all, anything u needed i can just call and she took care of right away, i give Alicia 2 dumbs up!!
I really enjoyed my stay here. Alicia is a real kind and welcoming host. I would definitely recommend staying here.

Alicia and her family are extremely friendly and helpful, always checking if I'm comfortable and well taken care of. Since the weather was cold, Alicia took steps like giving me extra blanket and turning up the heating to make sure I had a comfortable stay at her place :) location is great and super close to the subway, awesome!
great location and a very artistic and clean space.

The location was great a 2 minute walk to st lawrence station gets you to central manhattan in 30- 40 mins approx. The area is also very nice i was initially concerned about staying in the bronx but even late at night i felt safe walking around there are shops everywhere a laundromat and lots of restaurants and the food is cheaper than manhattan

The room was clean. I wasn't able to meet Alicia but I met her husband who was very nice and gave me a lot of advices on my stay in NY.
Alicia is an artist and the appartment is decorated with many paintings.

This is a great deal.  Its location is only a block off a train stop (5-blocks from the express line), and Alicia's recommendation regarding a nearby coffee shop was 'spot on.'  The Bronx may be some distance away from the 'action' area of Manhattan, but the no. 6 line provides easy connections to the numerous other lines serving Manhattan.
I meet Iván, Alicia's husband, and he was so kind and helpful with directions and places to go. The dorm was perfect for a traveler and the house very close to the subway station.
A good match of the price and comfort. Safe neighborhood. The subway station is very near. The host is very kind and polite.
No issues, nice place !
A wonderful place to stay, and a great place to get introduced to the spirit of NYC.
It was very pleasurable stay , room was quiet and cozy, I am having asthma and Alicia helped me a lot
It was great
Hummmm

The place was exactly what you get for such a low price, small but comfortable. It is a basement apt, so keep that in mind. I never saw Alicia but her husband was nice. I had a good stay, it was close to the train and restaurants which was nice

Great little place in a vibrant true-New-York neighborhood! Very close to the 6 train with very easy access to Manhattan. Not totally spotless or bug-free (it's a basement apartment), this place probably isn't for someone looking for a hotel experience, but it is a great value and a real, authentic New York experience. Recommended for solo travelers in need of a comfortable bed with easy access to Manhattan.
Really great neighborhood with good people. Nice cheap restaurants and bars. Even if I wasn't staying I would visit up there.
Did not meat Alicia but her stand-in Nikki was great! Had to check in late as the room wasnt ready. Room could have been cleaner. Otherwise worth the price!

This is my second stay with Alicia whom I met for the first time, It was again a very pleasant stay i liked the place and the room was very comfy it even had a fan to keep me cool. The area was very nice with families and children playing outside late into the evening which made the area feel very safe. There are laundromats and places to eat nearby and the subway was a 3 minute walk away. All i will say is get to know the subway system it would make your stay even better.
Alicia is a great host! The location is very convenient and the place is nice.
Alicia is so nice and friendly person! The room was exactly what i needed for few days to visit and see NY. Nice neighborhood, near to the subway station, restaurants.

Alicia and her husband Ivan were really nice and friendly people. The room was clean. Location was not that close to center however the price of the room justifies it. If you need a cheap, basic, clean room and don't bother to be far away from the city center this room might be a good decision.
Great place
This house is a block from the subway and a Dunkin Donuts. The directions airbnb gives is I think wrong. Use the address on her page.
Great place to stay in the Bronx, literally a minute away from the train that goes into the tourist areas!

Alicia, Ivan, their two (Hidden by Airbnb) and visiting friends made me feel at home in their space and warmly integrated into their circle of friends. the occasions when they invited me for beers or art at a cultural event gave me wonderful insights into a world very different from my own, it felt like crossing a great divide but being met with open arms.

Alicia's place is great!  It's in a lively neighborhood, with a bunch of places to eat very close by.  Parking was never a problem, either.  The room was comfortable and they have Netflix in the room, which is a nice touch.  Alicia and Ivan are amazing hosts, I'd definitely recommend staying with them!
Near to subway station, plenty of food stalls around (pizza from john’s pizza was great). The room has a tv which was a plus. Overall, it was worth the price paid.

Place is great for people on the move,  and even if you do need to take a day for yourself you have Netflix.  The local restaurant and shop owners are pretty nice if your open to being social and learning about the people.  The area is lively and I just loved it.

I Moved To NYC From Upstate For Work And This Room Was My First Airbnb. I Was Nervous About Booking It Because I Didn’t Know How Airbnb’s Worked! When I Checked In, Alicia Wasn’t In Town. Nor Was She In Town During My Entire Stay. I Got Comfortable With The Area Very Quick Because Soundview Had Alot Of Restaurants & Stores And It Was A Quiet, Friendly Neighborhood. The Location Was Perfect For Me! Nicki (One Of The Roommates) Introduced Herself To Me & Was Sooo Helpful During My Stay- Shes Super Nice! Nicki & The Other Roommate Had Schedules Different From Mine, So It Was Convenient. I Wouldn’t Recommend This Airbnb For Stays Longer Than A Month, Due To The Fact That Theres Two Other People That Permanently Live Here Besides Alicia & Her Husband. Also This Apartment Is In The Basement, So I Never Had Service When I Would Talk To My Family Or FaceTime Them. But Other Than That, My Stay Was Decent For It Being My First Airbnb & Me Having To Budget My Money. It’s A Good Room To Learn The Bronx.
Great stay. Right next to the train and parking is not bad. I would definitely stay there again.
Good place to stay for the price didn't meet Alicia but her husband Ivan was friendly and helpful.
Perfect for my needs and a great value. Would stay there again for sure.

Nice place, well worth the money.

Easy access to the metro, and downtown buses.

the stay was lovely, the room was a great size and came w/ it’s own ac/unit and you got a key to have access to the home whenever you’d like. it was in the midst of a lot of restaurants and amenities. my only issue is that the owner was completely unreachable, I tried to contact her many times during my stay and could not get in touch at all.

This Room smelled like body odor and bed linen was not clean. Bathroom was dirty and room was dusty. Had to sleep with light on because there was too much activity outside. I had to buy  2 plastic bed covers and my own sheets. Not a good first time experience.

Nice clean place for economy accomodation. It's quiet enough, with a lot of the fine Alicia's paintings on the walls and  nice neighbourhood. During all my visit I hadn't any problems. The host was very attentive, I'm very grateful.
Very nice place. Exactly as described. Overall pleasant experience.
すぐに返事がきて丁寧に連絡してをとっていただいてとてもよかったです｡部屋も綺麗で清潔感がありいい匂いがしました!
Had a good stay here. The apartment is a bit dark as it is in the basement but there is a small window in the room. Also nice that they have an AC and microwave in the room.
I had a great experience spending the night here. The room was clean and had everything that was needed. The room is really close to a 6 line station which made traveling anywhere super easy.
Alicia was a great host and everyone in the house was very nice and welcoming . I felt at home & it worth every dime !
Is confortable!
This is a perfect place if you’re looking for a bed to sleep in and a shower to freshen up at the end of the day. The room is very basic, but is hygienic. I highly recommend it for the price!
Great location, and great host!

Alicia's house is a great value if you need a simple spot with easy access to the subway (just a 5 minute walk from the 6 train). The room was clean and neighbors were very friendly. The neighborhood is a very authentic experience of the Bronx and I would suggest staying here if you are a solo traveler with plans to explore the city.
Amazing bang for your buck compared to almost all places in the city for the same price. Block and a half from the 6. AC unit and fan in the room were refreshing!

Had a pretty good time while i was there, came in whenever and it was silent , never saw alicia but the other host was nice , right next to 6 train so that was perfect the area was ok, i felt safe enough and for the price you couldn’t beat ! Would get something close to city next time but for what its worth it’s a bed and desk, if you’ll be out most of the time you’ll be good ! Also the other airbnb guest ( a man ) was helpful didn’t get his name
Thanks Alicia

I had a great stay in Bronx! The house wasn't modern, of course. But it was quite clean, especially my room was very neat. The hosts obviously take care of the place. 
The people living there are extremely nice and helpful, I felt totally welcome! 
The only downside is the neighbourhood. Actually all the people I've met on the streets were really nice, but it's still a ghetto and you don't feel that safe at night. But that should be obvious. As a woman traveling by myself I would'nt come home late in the night alone at least.
But besides a recommendable place to stay in a diverse area of NY.
Muy bien el lugar
The place was central and the people very very friendly. Good and beautiful for lone adventurers. thanks for the great host :)

I’m happy with my stay. Nice and friendly neighborhood, have no problem even when I’m walking back  from subway 4am. Alicia wasn’t there but she keep check on me every now and then just to make sure all is well. Ivan is there to help me and he is a friendly guy which I enjoy talking to. I would definitely come back and stay here again the next time I visit NYC again.
Thank you! :)
It was cute and cozy for a very good price.... thank you for allowing me to stay at your place last minute
I had a great stay here it was very clean and comfortable to be in for a couple of nights. The people were very generous and I could not ask for a better stay!
Very friendly host and neighbors. Good price and location is good. Useful stores are less than a block away. Ideal for people on a budget.
Keep it up. You are a great host

Chambre  agréable et logement bien placé (proche de la ligne 6). 
Cela correspond très bien aux personnes qui ont besoin d'une chambre lors de leur voyage à New York.

This is a great place! I've stayed here before and probably will again. Very conveniently located near the subway and there's also plenty of parking. Very clean and cozy and there's Netflix in the room too! And they are great hosts. I'd definitely recommend staying here.
Excellent room that’s close to the train. WiFi worked perfectly and the bed was very comfortable.
The host is very friendly, the location is nice and safe. You can find restaurants and grocery stores just a block way. All in all it was a pleasent stay.

With a last minute work trip there’s not much time to look for a place to stay, luckily I found Alicia’s place. The area is close to the train, stores, and it’s in a good area. The “no curfew” rule works great especially for those on vacation who want to hit up night clubs. Couldn’t ask for anything more. Hosts were amazing and very undertanding and helpful even after my plane was delayed. Thanks for everything guys, see ya soon....
It was nice to stay in Alicia's house. It is quite and cozy place. Ivan is very hospitable, he makes the stay as pleasant and comfortable as possible.
Great place. Great host.. Very accommodating.

If you are an ex-Nu Yawka or enjoy the vibe of a New York neighborhood, this is a good place to stay at a very affordable price. The bathroom and bedroom were clean and I was provided with everything I needed with plenty of privacy. Walk one block and you will find everything you want from the multitude of stores and restaurants. I will come back on my next trip.

name: Historic East Village Townhouse
space: This classic East Village 2 BR, 2.5 Bath Townhouse is ideally located just blocks from Union Square and will give you access to the best of New York City. You will have complete access to the entire first, second and third floors of this historic home (the top floor is an art studio), including a full kitchen, a bedroom/office with full bath, a garden terrace, another half bathroom, a large, sunny 2nd floor open living room/dining room with a huge L couch, and the third floor bedroom/full bathroom.  The house is classically furnished with a combined collection of antique and contemporary decor. A great place to spend a few days in NYC any time of year, but especially the summer!  Just a short walk from many of the city's major subway lines (4,5,6,N,Q,R,L) easy access to most others (B,D,F,M,1,2,3), and close (15 minute walk or less) to Greenwich Village, Gramercy, Alphabet City, West Village, Lower East Side, the location could not be more central! And despite the prime location, the h

You will have complete access to the entire first, second and third floors of this historic home (the top floor is an art studio), including a full kitchen, a bedroom/office with full bath, a garden terrace, another half bathroom, a large, sunny 2nd floor open living room/dining room with a huge L couch, and the third floor bedroom/full bathroom.  The house is classically furnished with a combined collection of antique and contemporary decor. A great place to spend a few days in NYC any time of year, but especially the summer!  Just a short walk from many of the city's major subway lines (4,5,6,N,Q,R,L) easy access to most others (B,D,F,M,1,2,3), and close (15 minute walk or less) to Greenwich Village, Gramercy, Alphabet City, West Village, Lower East Side, the location could not be more central! And despite the prime location, the h
neighborhood_overview: East Village
house_rules: You will have complete access to the first 3 floors of my historic home. I will not be here while renting the space but there is a basement tenant who will be around to help in case you should need anything. The only guests staying in the house are those who signed up to come. And if one or two other people visit they should only be people you know well. There is no smoking in the house.

host.host_location: New York, New York, United States
host.host_about: I'm a long time environmentalist who runs a national organization exploring the renewable energy sources and clean vehicle fuels needed for a healthy future. I love to travel and meet new people and I've learned that airbnb is a great way to give others access to my primary residence while I am away from the city! Please feel free to contact me with any questions you may have.

reviews.comments: Joanna's house was lovely and homey--a real taste of NYC life! We were able to choose which bedroom we wished to use, enjoyed the lovely living/dining area and kitchen, and we also became acquainted with her two adorable kitties. Sadly, the weather did not permit us to try out the deck in the rear, but it looked beautiful and welcoming. The location was very convenient for a number of things we wanted to do and a neighbor was available to contact should any emergencies arise (there were none). If you decide to stay in Joanna's beautiful home, you won't be disappointed!
Beautyful located place, right next to Union Square. Joanna is wonderful and so are her two cats. We would definitely stay at her place again. Thank you, Joanna!

We booked the house for Xmas holiays 2013, we're a bunch of 5 people from Italy.
Location is amazing, very close to Union Square and the metro, basically you can go everywhere from here. The street is quiet and the brownstone building is really great, it gives you that feeling of being a "Newyorker" rather tahn simply a tourist.
The house is huge and with lots of character, it's on 3 levels plus there's an art studio in the attic. It's a real house where Joanna lives, so you really get the feeling of being in your home and not on holiday. There are tons of objects and arts (mostly paintings) everywhere, it's also possible to visit the art studio, if you love arts, you definitely have to pay a visit, it's definitely interesting.
Joanna is a great host, always replying to every e-mail and message. We had a huge delay with our flight, due to bad weather in Europe, and she was so kind to wait for us until late night, even if she had to leave for the countryside. She also helped us to stop 2 taxis in the street to get to the airport on our last day, very kind of her!
On the negative sides, being a huge and very old house, full of tons of personal objects, books and arts, it's also dusty and cleanliness is not up to Italian standards, but, then again it's an historic brownstone building not a new built house, so we were expecting something like that. 
A tip for Italian people only, beware that, as usual in foreign countries, there's no bidet in the bathrooms!

There is only one place to stay in New York, and that is in this beautiful home. The location is superb and it is absolutely massive. The decor is amazing, like staying in an Art Gallery, but not one where you feel you have to tiptoe around to avoid breaking anything....

Plus Joanna is the perfect host, she answers every question promptly and goes out of her way to help in whatever way she can. 

Stop looking at other places, just book this one now.

We couldn't have been more pleased with our experience with Joanna and our stay at her brownstone. Joanna was incredibly helpful and kind through the whole process, and her place was warm and inviting. It was like staying at a favorite relative's place. The location could not be beat, either! It was so convenient to be near grocery stores, shops,and Union Square station. This place - and Joanna - are a delight!

I stayed with 3 girlfriends at Joanna's house in August 2014 for 4 nights. The house is perfectly located just a couple blocks from Union Square. You have access to several subway lines, a Whole Foods, Trader Joe's and a ton of restaurants, bars all within a few blocks - can walk to anything you need. The house is huge. There's a well stocked kitchen with a big table on the first floor, along with an office/den that has a private bath. The middle floor is a massive living/dining area. The top floor has a big master bedroom with the most comfortable bed ever. Joanna is very sweet & accommodating to all your needs. She left us some food & coffee in the kitchen & even bought us gluten free granola when she found out some of us couldn't eat wheat! She was very responsive to all our inquiries as well. I highly recommend her house. It's very spacious & you will feel like you are at home. Joanna is a great hostess!

Four of us, two who'd never been to NYC, felt we were living in the East Village rather than visiting or being tourists.  The neighborhood has everything--restaurants, movies, Trader Joe's and Whole Foods, cabs when you want one.  The home is gorgeous--art everywhere! Loved taking a break in the afternoon or late at night sprawled in the living room. Joanna provided maps and tour books, and some grocery items to get us started.  She couldn't be there when we arrived so had her friend greet us--he gave us grand tour of the house, helped with luggage and recommendations. Thank you!

We had a wonderful week in Joanna's beautiful brownstone, located in a quiet street just a block away from Union Square. The house has everything to wish for: comfortable bedrooms with their own baths, large livingroom area and a cosy well-equipped kitchen. All in a gorgeous setting. We felt like true New Yorkers!

There were four of us, two couples, that stayed at Joanna's.  Joanna greeted us when we arrived and gave us a tour of her spacious historic brownstone home with detailed information. 

As noted on her site, her home is conveniently located to union square, easy access to transportation and she also provided maps and site information. 

Staying at Joanna's provided us an authentic East Village experience.  Don't miss the opportunity to stay at Joanna's!

We arrived an hour late as we were coming from JFK on public transport and had misjudged the time.  Joanna needed to leave soon after we arrived so we did not get a full tour of the house before she left, however she left us cheese, wine, crackers, cereal, coffee and milk to get us started on our stay.
As we explored the house following the extensive note that she left for us, it met all of our expectations.  It was large with plenty of room for the adults in our party.  We especially enjoyed the living room where we could plan our days or recover from a day of touring in comfort.
The location of the Brownstone is superb - near restaurants and shops and close to the subway.  Joanna left it beautifully decked out for the holidays with a decorated tree and poinsettias throughout the house.  
Our only problem was minor - the wifi password did not work but we found a work around to solve the problem.
We highly recommend staying in this property.

There is no better way to experience a life different from your own than by doing so first hand. Joanna's wonderful brownstone provides that better way. 

Everything, both inside and out, make you feel like you've been living here most of your life. So much to see and do, all well within walking distance, and the pedestrian traffic density is just enough to allow one to move to and fro effortlessly and with great comfort, even well after the shows and theatres have let out for the evening.

Dining experiences of all types abound, many close at hand or a short cab or train ride away, or hit the local markets (there are many to chose from) and make a feast to share with family and friends. Joanna's is well equipped to host a dinner party which we did (our first in NY) - sharing a wonderful evening with old friends and new. 

All that it's described in her bio on her home is spot on and the photos do not do it justice. This is a well lived, well loved, oasis that will provide all the space and amenities one could ever need to experience life in New York. Joanna was always available to answer all our questions and is one of the nicest people we've ever had the opportunity to meet. 

We come to New York every year for both business and pleasure.

This time it felt like we came home.

Wir haben die Tage in dem Haus von Joanna sehr genossen! 
Das Haus ist mit viel Liebe zum Detail eingerichtet! Die Lage ist optimal!

Une maison extradordinaire qui vous fait vous sentir comme un vrai new-yorkais. Super quartier. A quelques rue de Mc Sorley's, le meilleur pub de New York
Un séjour inoubliable

Joanna arranged for a colleague of hers to meet us at her home and show us around when we first arrived and she dropped in in person to say hello and make sure that we had everything we needed for our stay. She had generously left a bottle of wine, artisan bread and some light refreshments to welcome us. After a long flight this was a highly appreciated gesture. We loved the liveliness of the East Village - where everything was on the doorstep - and the wonderful cafe next door where we could take mugs from Joanna's kitchen for our take out coffees in the morning to enjoy on the outside deck. Joanna's house is a treasure trove of wonderful artworks and antiques and perfect for our cultural visit to New York. The free WIFI included was very helpful as were all the recommendations for things to do locally. Joanna was a clear communicator who responded to all enquiries quickly and clearly. I would highly recommend Joanna's place and sincerely hope that I will be fortunate enough to make a return visit as there are a thousand things I have still to see and do in NYC.

We enjoyed our stay.  To have that much space in NYC is unusual.  Joanna is very sweet and accommodating.  It's a very casual, lived-in atmosphere, which we like.  The neighborhood was good, and convenient to the subway, which was about two blocks away.

A very nice place (I would say more: an incredible place in the center of Manhattan) and a very nice host. Everything is available and if you need a base (as we did) to visit your son at college or to move in one closeby NYU dorm it is perfect.
Very happy to have choosen it. 
Federico

We were so warmly welcomed by Joanna into her lovely East Village house that we immediately felt at home. We just loved her house with all its character and we really felt like it was our place for the 12 days. There were three floors so we had ample space for two couples  with plenty of privacy when needed. The photos on AirB&B are very accurate. The location was fabulous, right next door to one of the best cafes for coffee in NY. It was within walking distance of so many great areas ( Greenwich Village, Soho, Chelsea Markets, Little Italy etc) and provided easy access to two subway stations. We loved the fresh green market at Union Square and the numerous food stores minutes from the house. Joanna was prompt in responding to our initial enquiry and then all subsequent communication. She was a wonderful host and we definitely hope to stay in her home ( if still available) when next visiting New York. We have no hesitation in recommending this property .

My retired parents and I stayed at Joanna's house in October. Joanna was warm and welcoming from her first email and this continued when she met us at the house to settle us in. Her home is located very centrally right amongst the action of Union Square. We enjoyed exploring the neighbourhood and especially the Union Square market with all its wonderful produce. Subway and bus stops were nearby making it easy to venture around Manhattan and beyond.
The house is a home, filled with objects from Joanna's life there since the late 1970s and the style of the home reflects her interest in art and the environment and felt a little like you might be in one of Woody Allen's films from the 80s (think Hannah and her Sisters). Family photos, paintings and books lined the walls and the kitchen was equipped for serious cooking.  The upstairs bedroom had a very comfortable bed, the second bedroom is a study with a pull out bed that would be fine for a short stay - that both rooms had their own bathrooms was very convenient and allowed us to feel quite self contained. 
The weekend we stayed was a long weekend and there was a lot of noise in the street all night. Joanna has said she will provide ear plugs for her guests use in future and this will make a difference for anyone who hasn't adjusted to the hustle and bustle of NYC.

Staying at Joannas house was a real treat. It is a great location, close to Union Square which has great subway links to the rest of the city as well as good restaurants and shops in the area. Also, there is  top class coffee right next door and a very good bar and restaurant across the street!
The house itself is full of character and charm. There were four of us for most of the stay and the spacious and comfortable living room/dining room area was a particular treat where we could hang out and spend time together without tripping over each other.
Joanne was a lovely host. She was very responsive at all times even though she has a busy life. We spent a few hours with her one evening and she was great company.
A great NYC experience!

A perfect East Village experience. 
Joanna's place was roomy, comfortable and charming. The location is ideal- near subways stops, restaurants, bars and coffee shops. Highly recommend to anyone looking for a neighborhood experience rather than a vanilla hotel.

Joanna's home is a real treasure trove bursting with character. It is exactly as it appears in the pictures. The apartment is in a great location in the East Village – close to bars, restaurants, markets and Union Square subway which is great for getting round the city. Each morning one of my party went out to one of the nearby cafes to get breakfast which we all enjoyed together around the great big dining room table! I particularly loved the living area on the middle floor. The apartment is extremely spacious and the bedrooms afford great privacy when with other couples. The apartment comes with free Wifi which was very very convenient. Joanna is an excellent host and I would recommend a stay here for an amazing and very different New York experience.

Once again Joanna opened her beautiful home to our family during our annual visit to the New York Toy Fair. Once again our stay was fantastic. As I had indicated in my first review, the best way to experience a city is to live in it - even if just briefly. This time around we were able to spend time with our gracious host which made it feel more like home. Joanna even made provision to accommodate an extra guest (eldest son - trip to celebrate his 20th birthday) which was most appreciated as he was also able to explore NY as a local. Request a stay here if you want to really experience life in the big Apple!

We just returned from a few days in Joanna's charming home. We found it absolutely ideal for our family of four, and have nothing but positive opinions about the lovely home, convenience of the location, and the plethora of superb restaurants and amenities just outside the front door in any direction. While it is unfortunate that we did not get to meet Joanna in person, her prompt responses and thoughtful communication were greatly appreciated. We arrived quite a bit earlier than I had arranged, yet were warmly welcomed by Joanna's friend, Suzanne, who has a painting studio on the top floor of the brownstone. It was a lovely gesture to leave us some cereal, milk, crackers and wine- a very nice touch. The house is very roomy for NYC, with 2 bedrooms and 2 1/2 baths, very unusual. I highly recommend this listing, it's a very special place and a true home away from home. I hope to return very soon!
Perfect location to EVERYTHING and an unbelievably huge brownstone with a generous and friendly host.

This house is a jewel in East Village! I loved this home and I'm grateful that Joanna shared it with me and my friends. Joanna (and her friend Melissa) we're the best, so welcoming and gracious. The house is oozing with charm and has everything you need to feel like to live in New York. I will definitely stay here again!

Everything about our stay at Joanna's house exceeded all our expectations.  The location, the style and the comfort of a well lived-in and much loved home far outshone those of the most luxurious hotel accommodation.

My only criticism would that it was so hard to leave!  Joanna's brownstone has warmth and character to put five-star hotels to shame, and its location simply could not be bettered.  Both Joanna and her neighbour who welcomed us when we arrived were helpfully attentive and made us feel at home from the moment we crossed the threshold.  If this residence looks like your kind of thing, then, trust me, it IS.  You don't want to miss it.

This was my second time staying at Joanna's, and I hope to return again in the near future as it has come to feel like a home away from home for me. Joanna is the perfect host in terms of prompt communication, warm welcome, and ease of check-in/check-out. Her downstairs neighbor and friend, Melissa, came by with her darling dog, Hazel to add to the charm of my brief stay in the brownstone. I look forward to my next visit, thanks Joanna, you really made me feel at home!

We had a wonderful stay at Joanna's beautiful home in the East Village. The house was perfect and the location was great for tourism - just a few blocks from the subway. Joanna was very accommodating and quick to answer any questions we had. We had a great experience and hope to return :)

We are a family of four who have just enjoyed a great half-term week in New York staying at Joanna's lovely old house.  Joanna was an excellent host, with prompt and helpful correspondence and provided us with useful local information.  The house itself is amazing - great character, loads of space, with a bohemian, arty feel to it.  The location is excellent - it felt very safe walking around at night and there are lots of bars, restaurants and shops within close walking distance.  It's about 5 minutes walk from Union Square (where the old guys play chess), and that was the subway station we used the most.  Thank you Joanna for a memorable stay!

We were welcomed by Joanna, who was waiting for us. She described and explained everything we needed to know in just couple of minutes and left us a house rules very easy to follow with all the basic instruction. 
After that we enjoyed chatting with her abt her house and the history you breath once you entered. 
We were lucky to meet her before she left town for work.
Definitely a lovely landlord who did everything possible to make us feel at home and to enjoy our few days in the Big Apple. 
Top location on the 13th street, easy access to Union Square subway even if we enjoyed walking up n down Manhattan. 

The second day we had a small issue with the heat (first few cold days in NY), which Melissa, downstairs neighbour and friend of Joanna, took immediately action to settle it, while Joanna kept keeping me updated and apologising for it even if definitely not her fault. 

Definitely a recommended place to stay and looking forward to come back soon.
A great spot in the middle of a fantastic area.Old world charm.Joanna made it feel like our home.
Excellent location, spacious, well-equipped.  It's a treat to stay in a historic and beautifully decorated New York City home.

Lovely Brownstone in a fantastic location for exploring the city. Lots of space to relax in after a hard day of site seeing or shopping! Joanna was an excellent host and I would recommend her house to a family or a group of friends as an great base for a Manhattan holiday.

The apartment could not have been in a better location. So close to bars and restaurants and fun. Joanna was a pleasure to deal with and answered all of our questions. We had a great time in the East Village. You will really enjoy this apartment.

The location of this property could not have been better. Plenty of first rate grocery, shopping and dining options within walking distance and close to a major subway station. Great coffee house next door too. Joanna had a last minute mix-up with arranging for someone to get us a key but it was straightened out with plenty of good communication by the time we arrived. This is our second Airbnb experience in NYC. The first place in Chelsea last year was great. This one was disappointing. First, Joanna runs a business from her residence and one of the employees has a key. Unknown to us, he apparently expects to be able to come by to pick up the mail. Joanna neglected to tell us about this (or even ask if this was ok) until I was at Whole Foods and got a text message from her that her employee was standing on the doorstep about to enter (apparently assuming the apartment was empty—it wasn’t; my wife and daughter happened to hear him outside talking on the phone; not knowing who he was or why he was there, they didn't respond to his repeated ringing of the doorbell). This was a very upsetting experience. If they had not overheard him telling someone he was going to use his key to go in and then taken it upon themselves to open the door and hand him the mail, it was clear he would have entered the apartment with his key on his own—imagine if you were in the bathroom or some other part of the residence and someone just walked in? Second, the unit was not clean. My wife had to scrub down the handles and top of the stove as well as the kitchen counters before being able to prepare and cook any meals. Likewise, the kitchen table (covered with small tiles) was filthy and had to be scrubbed before we could eat there. The kitchen chairs have wicker seats that are well-worn and not very sturdy (and there are several of the same chairs in the entry hallway with seats that have actually fallen through). The kitchen floor needed a good scrubbing (which we just had to ignore) and there was a film of grease throughout the kitchen walls and cabinets and on the pots and pans that were stored outside the cabinets. The bathrooms were not any better as far as cleanliness was concerned. The shower in the downstairs bathroom is only about 5.5 feet high and doesn’t adjust so if you are taller than that, taking a shower is a real challenge. Thankfully the weather was great as there is only central heating and it doesn’t appear that there is any air conditioning (a window unit is stored on the floor of the closet in the downstairs bedroom so perhaps Joanna pulls that out when summer arrives and A/C is needed). Lastly, Joanna wants her guests to follow her rules about trash, recycling and composting which are fine...

We could not have been happier with this home.  Located a block from Union Square, it was the perfect residence for a recent business trip to NYC and the surrounding area.  It has tons of space (three floors) and so much charm.  It provides an authentic New York experience (proper house in an interesting neighborhood) and is centrally-located for convenient access to wherever you want to go.  Will certainly come back to this home on future trip.  Joanna is also a wonderful person and host - I'm glad I was able to meet her at the beginning of the stay to learn more about the history of the home.

A fantastic experience -  This is a beautiful brownstone home -  NYC living the way it should be done!  When you are inside, you forget there is a bustling city right outside your door - very quiet, elegant place. It covers 3 floors, beautifully appointed, cross ventilation from windows but air conditioners also all worked perfectly. Great, great host. Perfect for our family of 4. One block from Union Sq subway station. While booking, we felt this would be a nice place, but once there it was far and above our expectations! Best of luck to this host!
Great experience all around.

This was our second time staying at 138 E. 13th St.  Joanna is an ideal host who felt like a friend from our first ten minutes with her, and her house is a wonder.  Ideally located in the heart of the East Village, it lays all of Manhattan at your feet while retaining an intimate neighborhood feel.  We wouldn't think of staying anywhere else in the future.  Don't miss it if you have the chance.

Location, location, location!  Joanna's place is on a quiet street but very near to Union Square - so very convenient for catching the train just about anywhere, as well as exploring the East Village and West Village.  Great restaurants and sweet shops nearby, too, including Everyman Espresso right next door.
Joanna showed us great hospitality.  We enjoyed the wonderful artwork on display and the comfortable and homey feel of this brownstone.  Thanks so much, Joanna!

Joanna is an amazing host, you will be lucky to find someone as kind and welcoming to stay in her house. THis place is amazing : it was beautiful and very creatively decorated with lot of amazing art and furniture. 
 I can say with honest certainty that this is the best Airbnb I have ever stayed in, and here is why: 
-liked i said before Joanna is a fantastic host! She doesn't do the bare minimum, she goes above and beyond to ensure that you have an amazing stay in her house .
This house is in an incredible location! , a block away from several key metro stations, and near some fantastic restaurants and grocery stores, you could not ask for a more affordable place in such an amazing neighborhood! 
The house itself is amazing!   it is an amazing aesthetic that you never want to leave! all the room are super clean and comfortable, so by the end of your stay, you'll want to just steal this house from her! . 
thank you joanna !!!!i hope to come back !!!!

This property is an eclectic traditional New York brownstone, conveniently located to subway stops, shops and restaurants. Lots of space. Each bedroom has its own bath. The upstairs bedroom does get a bit of city sounds at night. The host is gracious and most accommodating and left  groceries to get us started. She also provided maps, travel tips, lists of restaurants and places to visit. Wifi and TV provided, also a plus. Be sure to visit the amazing coffee shop just next door.
Joanna's house was beautiful, full of artwork and charming furniture, and perfectly located. We had an amazing time there!

Joanna's home is the perfect place to stay in NYC.  We could not have asked for a more gracious and helpful host. I have visited the city many times and stayed in other airbnb's, but this was the best location and perfect for two couples, since it has 2 1/2 bathrooms...a rarity in NYC.  Her home had lovely furnishings and art which made it hard to leave each day.  Most importantly, her response was immediate, she greeted us when we arrived, showed us around her home and  provided us a good bit of information on places to shop for groceries, restaurants, farmers markets, museums, etc.  I would definitely stay again the next time I visit the city.
Great location and a lot of curios!

It's a NYC brownstone.  Classic.  NYC.  A real NYC stoop (ok, maybe that's not so cool for you, but for me, that's something I've always (Website hidden by Airbnb) sit on the stoop).   A terrace.  Lived in and loved.  Clean.  Charming squeaky wood floors and narrow stairs.  A graceful balance.  Did I mention a terrace?  Great location near NYU.  Convenient to everything.  This was my first Airbnb rental and I'm sure I'm spoiled now ;-)

Exceptional home, exceptional hostess. An opportunity to have a soulful unique experience of New York that we will remember. A million miles from generic hotel life; lots of quirky details, atmosphere and charm and a warm and flexible hostess. Highly recommended to those who respond to beauty and idiosyncrasies

It was a fantastic experience for our family to stay in this historical house in the heart of Manhattan and to meet Joanna, a very special person. If you value things like history, style, art, charm and sustainability, this is the place. This is a unique place.  If you are more interested in a kind of standardized high-tech american hotel room, maybe this is not the best choice. We will go back for sure. Thanks Joanna!
Joanna’s place is wonderful! Very close by to many places and extremely cozy and convenient! I had an amazing stay, and highly recommend staying in her artsy beautiful home. Joanna is also so sweet!

The house is a classic New York townhouse, full of art and personality. It offers three floors of space plus a terrace garden. The owner is an excellent guide, both in person and in writing, to the many attraction within a short walk--cinema, restaurants, the Public Theater, coffee bars, etc. With the Union Square subway station around the corner, the house is ideally located for exploring the city. Don't expect the unreasonable--you won't likely find giant kitchens or hear pins drop in the East Village. You will get history, charm, and Manhattan at your doorstep.
È una casa straordinaria , piena di fascino , oggetti d’arte e ricordi di una vita.

Joanna's brownstone exceeded our expectations. It is a beautiful 
Town Home located within steps of terrific restaurants, parks, grocery stores and the thriving centers of many of NY City's most exciting villages. Joanna was a superb host. Checking in and out was a breeze and she provided us with outstanding personal recommendations for restaurants and places to visit during our stay. Our family can't wait to return the next time we travel to NY.

Joanna’s house is amazing. Such a beautiful old property in a great location with excellent transport links. Joanna is a kind and thoughtful host and we would definitely stay there again if in New York.
This is a unique townhouse, very spacious, filled with art and other collections. My family enjoyed a wonderful Christmas. We found it very convenient. Joanna was a thoughtful host.

This home is fantastic - truly a New York feeling, well placed in the Eastern village and oozing with local charms.  The house is a heritage building, wood floors, brick walls, old fireplaces and full of art  What more could anyone ask for?  The ambience and vibes in the home are very, very positive and it feels like a restful sanctuary within the exciting energy of the big apple. The house was clean, well furnished - a graceful repos from the hard day of experiencing all New York offers.  I highly recommend the location.

Joanna’s house is wonderful, staying there is an experience to remember for ever. Our two pre-teen kids  loved it. The house is full of seriously good art works (by her husband, a celebrated painter) , and a lovely mix of modern and antique furniture. The location couldn’t be better, not so far down the Lower East Side that you feel like you’re in a night club, and yet close to some really good restaurants and bars. Joanna is a really friendly host, and everything worked as clockwork, despite our last minute booking. Highly recommended.

name: Rustic Home in Perfect Location
summary: Enjoy a quiet and peaceful retreat in a rustic home and still be within short walking distance to shops, trains and buses, parks and beaches.
space: Your bedroom is quiet and peaceful. The house itself is full of rustic charm, furnished in an eclectic style with lots of art and books. Open plan, light and airy with living area opening onto pleasant courtyard.  It is in a great location - close to everything - shops, transport, parks, and beaches.
description: Enjoy a quiet and peaceful retreat in a rustic home and still be within short walking distance to shops, trains and buses, parks and beaches. Your bedroom is quiet and peaceful. The house itself is full of rustic charm, furnished in an eclectic style with lots of art and books. Open plan, light and airy with living area opening onto pleasant courtyard.  It is in a great location - close to everything - shops, transport, parks, and beaches. Bedrooms other than your own are off-limits to guests. You are welcome to use the kitchen and dining areas, but this does not include entertaining your own guests or visitors. I am well-travelled and enjoy meeting new people. Although I'm usually pretty busy, there is usually time for great conversation around the kitchen table, a shared a meal or drink, or simply sharing local knowledge. The house is in a great location for accessing all the best parts of Sydney. Close to beaches and parks and easy access to the city and universities. A 10-minute wa
neighborhood_overview: The house is in a great location for accessing all the best parts of Sydney. Close to beaches and parks and easy access to the city and universities. A 10-minute walk gets you to Bondi Junction train station and Bondi Junction itself, which is like a mini-city with all services and shopping ranging from Armani to Zara, as well as a multiplex cinema. (Art house cinemas are short bus rides away.)  A 5-minute walk to the local village of Charing Cross and you will find cool cafes, interesting shops, a cheap gym, two pubs with good menus and atmosphere, one of the best Vietnamese restaurants in Sydney, awesome, healthy food and even fine dining. There is also a late-night local supermarket that has a good selection of everything from basics to gourmet food.  Bondi, Tamarama and Bronte beaches and ocean pools are a 5-minute drive or 20-minute walk away - or you can take the bus.  Waverley Oval is nearby or walk to Queens Park and on to beautiful Centennial Park.  You can walk or catch a bus
notes: There is an indoor/outdoor cat so this may be a consideration for some guests.
transit: From Bondi Junction, it is a 10-minute train ride into the city centre (trains run frequently). There are also buses which go in every direction - to the beach, to the city and to universities - UNSW, UNSW Art & Design, UTS, and Sydney University (also by train).
access: Bedrooms other than your own are off-limits to guests. You are welcome to use the kitchen and dining areas, but this does not include entertaining your own guests or visitors.
interaction: I am well-travelled and enjoy meeting new people. Although I'm usually pretty busy, there is usually time for great conversation around the kitchen table, a shared a meal or drink, or simply sharing local knowledge.
house_rules: No smoking at all in the inside areas of the house please.  No overnight guests.  This is a residential area so noise needs to be kept to a reasonable level - no parties and no visitors. You are welcome to use the kitchen facilities but please clean up after use, leaving everything the way you found it. Please respect the space of those who live here. Access to wifi Internet is included but downloading of movies, etc. is discouraged, unless through an authorised site. Please do not take bath towels to the beach, gym, etc. Replacement cost of lost towels is $50 each.

host.host_about: Hi, I am a Sydney-based writer and academic who used to work in the film industry. I try to travel somewhere each year and, once there, like to get into what a place has to offer. Surfing, yoga and (sort of) running break up my time at a desk. I read, go to movies, art galleries, museums, music etc a lot. Also like just hanging out and good conversation. I have my own home so am very respectful of the space of others.

reviews.comments:
Well,
I felt very comfortable in my room and the 
living area "warmly atmosphere ".  Karen is a really pretty person she's always up for a friendly conversation ready and gives good tips for everything! 
The location is perfect, close the City and to the beaches:) 
I'll never forget the time with Karen here, and can only recommend this accommodation. Peace & love Florian
The host canceled this reservation 87 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Karen was a fantastic host throughout our stay, she made us feel welcome and did everything she could to help us. The home has a lot of character and is in a great location, half way between Waverley and Bondi Junction so getting around was simple.

Karen was a very nice and good host. She answered quickely and give information and tips for nice places to eat, to visit and how to travel. The room and the bathroom were clean and very comfortable and the kitchen and livingroom were als nice to use. It is a very attractively house with garden and I felt really home. The location is very good, because close to beaches and to a bus/train station.
离邦迪海滩非常近,走路十分钟就到了,靠海边那块全是这种house,车也不多很安静｡附近有商场和购物街道,房东人也很好,想在邦迪海滩附近玩的值得推荐｡
